speaker: Maelle
line: If you’re gonna give someone flowers, you should probably do it BEFORE they wither and die.

speaker: Gustave
line: What, the flower? Or Sophie?

speaker: Maelle
line: Ooh, dark. Sophie would approve. Hey, you said it, not me. The others are waiting for you, you’re supposed to be helping with the festival.

speaker: Gustave
line: With what? Putting three tables? They’ll manage.

speaker: Maelle
line: Ah. You underestimate Lumière’s enthusiasm for the Expedition. There’s at least FIVE tables.

speaker: Gustave
line: Marvellous.

speaker: Maelle
line: Have you tried throwing with your other arm instead? If you could hit the Paintress directly, that would actually be useful.

speaker: Gustave
line: You know, hobbies don’t always have to be useful. I’m enjoying the uselessness of today, and readying my usefulness for tomorrow. And soon, we’ll get to do a lot more than throw rocks.

speaker: Maelle
line: That’s what all the other expeditions said too.

speaker: Gustave
line: Heyheyhey. You know, you know they gave their lives to lay the trail for us, right?

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah, I know, sorry.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah.

speaker: Maelle
line: You still got a flower to give, no?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yes, yes. It’s just… I’m not sure how to start. After four years apart, what do I say to her, on the day of her Gommage.

speaker: Maelle
line: You’re asking ME? I dunno, sun’s about to set, so… be direct? “Hey Soph-been a while. Could we–”

speaker: Maelle
line: All right, let’s go. I’ll accompany you there. Are you… ready to see her again?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, been ready.

speaker: Maelle
line: I set up these grapple shortcuts. Nice, huh? Don’t tell your sister, though. I sort of “borrowed” the hooks from the Expedition Academy. Wish I had them when I was working as a courier… Come on, Gustave, speed up a bit. Sophie will have already gommaged by the time you’ve arrived.

speaker: Gustave
line: Maelle.

speaker: Maelle
line: I can’t believe Sophie already turned 33… She looks so much younger than you.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thanks.

speaker: Maelle
line: She’s popular, I’m sure she already has a necklace full of flowers.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hm. I can imagine.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hmm…

speaker: Gustave
line: What?

speaker: Maelle
line: You look tense.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I, hum… Yeah.

speaker: Maelle
line: I know what you need! A little duel!

speaker: Gustave
line: No.

speaker: Maelle
line: Come on, it’ll loosen you up. You can’t go and see Sophie all sombre and tense.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hmmm…

speaker: Maelle
line: And… if you win, I’ll give you something you can use with your Lumina Converter.

speaker: Gustave
line: Alright, you’re on.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yes!

speaker: Maelle
line: You won! Now, don’t you feel better? I see your smile. All right, now let’s go find Sophie. I saw her near the red and white tree.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah.

speaker: Maelle
line: Oh, the Plaza is lively. Why people like to celebrate the Gommage is still a mystery to me, but, oh, well. The red and white tree… I’ve always found it beautiful. I don’t really understand. You and Sophie broke up so long ago. But clearly, you never got over her. Why’d you wait until today to say something? It’s a bit late, isn’t it? Sophie is down there.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I know.

speaker: Maelle
line: I… Good luck. I’ll be here for you if things… don’t go as planned.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thanks.

speaker: Sophie
line: …the last few days meant everything.

speaker: Gustave
line: …Could we talk?

speaker: Sophie
line: Gustave. I love you all.

speaker: Gustave
line: For your, um– If there’s room…

speaker: Sophie
line: There’s always room.

speaker: Gustave
line: You know, I’m sorry that…

speaker: Sophie
line: I missed you–

speaker: Gustave
line: I missed you too.

speaker: Sophie
line: You don’t need to– (laugh) Okay.

speaker: Gustave
line: You go.

speaker: Sophie
line: No, you.

speaker: Gustave
line: You, uh– You know how I fell. I– I wish things had been– You know… I often think– Another path, you know… Another future–

speaker: Sophie
line: Still can’t finish your sentences, can you?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, that hasn’t changed…

speaker: Sophie
line: I missed that. I never faulted you for wanting to believe. You’re fighting. To change things. I understand, I just… In a “different world”, right?

speaker: Gustave
line: We’ll break the cycle. So She can’t steal anyone else’s future.

speaker: Sophie
line: Stubborn people change the world. And you are the most stubborn person I know. Thank you. Walk me to the harbour?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yes.

speaker: Tiffanie
line: Oh, hi, Sophie. So Gustave really did come, huh?

speaker: Sophie
line: Hm, yeah, he did.

speaker: Tiffanie
line: I knew he would.

speaker: Sophie
line: Looks like you still have a lot of flowers left.

speaker: Tiffanie
line: Well, there are less and less people to buy them… I just wish you didn’t have to wear one.

speaker: Sophie
line: Tiffanie…

speaker: Tiffanie
line: I should finish cleaning up here and join everyone at the harbour. See you.

speaker: Sophie
line: See you…

speaker: Gustave
line: I can’t imagine what you’re going through…

speaker: Sophie
line: I’m fine.

speaker: Gustave
line: (sceptical grunt)

speaker: Sophie
line: I’m FINE. I’ve lived 33 good years. Look around. We’ve had our whole lives to prepare. We’re all fine. Mostly.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m not fine.

speaker: Sophie
line: You will be.

speaker: Cyril
line: Ah, the scintillating Sophie! You’re as gorgeous as always!

speaker: Sophie
line: Cyril, you flatterer. Need some help with your writing again?

speaker: Cyril
line: Beautiful and perceptive, per usual. See, I’m preparing the headline for tomorrow, and who could write it better than someone who celebrates her special day today!

speaker: Sophie
line: Hm, true. So, what will the article be about?

speaker: Cyril
line: Actually…

speaker: Sophie
line: You don’t know?

speaker: Cyril
line: Well…

speaker: Sophie
line: You really are lazy.

speaker: Cyril
line: Help me again, Sophie, please. My boss will kill me…

speaker: Sophie
line: Sure, let me think of a headline…

speaker: Sophie
line: Expedition 33 shall be the destined journey.

speaker: Cyril
line: A headline about the Expedition… That’s bold. Nobody really cares about them anymore after their constant failures. But that would make a wonderful underdog story. Okay, now I’m inspired. You really are a divine being, Sophie.

speaker: Sophie
line: Don’t forget to credit me.

speaker: Cyril
line: I would never… Thank you for all these times.

speaker: Sophie
line: It’s always been a pleasure, my friend. Take care of yourself.

speaker: Cyril
line: Yeah…

speaker: Estelle
line: Hey, you. You seem like a woman with exquisite taste. I just finished my sculpture to the legendary Esquie. This may be my life’s finest work, yet not a single soul seems to care. How could I make it better?

speaker: Sophie
line: Perhaps you could paint it? Add some colours?

speaker: Estelle
line: Paint it? Hmm… Brilliant. I knew you were the right person to ask. Thank you for your insight!

speaker: Sophie
line: You’re most welcome.

speaker: Estelle
line: I shall get to work tomorrow. I see you’re wearing flowers. What’s your name?

speaker: Sophie
line: Sophie.

speaker: Estelle
line: Sophie, as a thank you, I shall chisel your name onto the statue.

speaker: Sophie
line: Oh, you don’t have to.

speaker: Estelle
line: But I will.

speaker: Ulysse
line: My Gestral costume is the best! Hey, madame, do you think the Gestrals really exist?

speaker: Sophie
line: Of course they do!

speaker: Ulysse
line: That’s what I think too. The others laugh, but I know they’re real. One day, I will meet one. Even if it means joining an Expedition! I’ll raise a Gestral army and we’ll crush the Paintress! And me and my little brother will live with the Gestrals and they’ll be our new family. We’re tired of the orphanage… If the legends are true, they really like to fight. That’s why I’m training everyday by beating up my little brother!

speaker: Sophie
line: That’s… Yeah. You would make a great Gestral.

speaker: Ulysse
line: Thanks!

speaker: Richard
line: Oh, Sophie, what a lovely smell.

speaker: Sophie
line: Thank you, Richard.

speaker: Richard
line: I could recognize it from miles away. It’s good you’re here, Sophie. I have a favor to ask of you.

speaker: Sophie
line: Anything for my beloved sewing teacher.

speaker: Richard
line: I… We are of the same cohort. Today is my Gommage. And… My son and I had a fight last night. He said he wants to join the Expedition… He wants to waste the last years of his life. I… I didn’t want that for him. I used to think it was a bad choice, but today, I no longer do. I know I made a mistake. I tried to impose my views on him when he is much braver than I will ever be. So I sewed a special uniforme for him as my last gift. Could you bring it to him?

speaker: Sophie
line: Of course. I’ll bring it to Jules.

speaker: Richard
line: He won’t join the Gommage ceremony, but he will be at the Expedition Festival tonight for sure. Oh, but you…

speaker: Sophie
line: Don’t worry, I’ll ask Gustave.

speaker: Richard
line: Gustave? Are you back together?

speaker: Sophie
line: For this moment… Maybe.

speaker: Richard
line: I’m glad… He is a good person.

speaker: Sophie
line: Yes, he is…

speaker: Richard
line: Thanks to both of you. And see you.

speaker: Sophie
line: See you.

speaker: Eloise
line: Hm…

speaker: Sophie
line: Is something wrong?

speaker: Eloise
line: The Expeditions… What a joke.

speaker: Eloise
line: All they do is leave us here to die. They’re just escaping.

speaker: Sophie
line: You know their goal is to save us all, right?

speaker: Eloise
line: Yeah, that’s what my father told me last year. Before he left for Expedition 34. And here we are again this year. We could have spent one more year together instead of wasting it away…

speaker: Sophie
line: Your father fought to offer you a better future…

speaker: Eloise
line: I have no future. I know it and I’ve accepted it. We’re doomed.

speaker: Sophie
line: You never know, this Expedition might be different. There are some special people in this one.

speaker: Eloise
line: Yeah, right…

speaker: Sophie
line: Gustave? Why don’t you show her some of your fighting skills to prove her wrong?

speaker: Eloise
line: That’s… This guy is strong…

speaker: Sophie
line: They all train their Pictos skills very hard to save us all. And so did your father.

speaker: Eloise
line: Then, madam, why didn’t you join?

speaker: Sophie
line: Me? I’m content with my life. I know what I can and cannot change. Or maybe… Because I was afraid.

speaker: Eloise
line: … Do you think… I should join the Expedition?

speaker: Sophie
line: My friend Sciel always says, do your best, either it works or it doesn’t. Live your life as you want.

speaker: Eloise
line: I… I don’t want to have regrets… I don’t have that much time…

speaker: Sophie
line: When the time comes, you’ll make the right decision. I’m sure.

speaker: Eloise
line: Thank you. Now I think I know… Give this to your boyfriend, my father gave it to me, but it might be more useful for him.

speaker: Ophélie
line: Hi, Gustave. You’re back. Did you want to pick out a different flower?

speaker: Gustave
line: No, the one you suggested earlier was perfect.

speaker: Ophélie
line: I’m glad. These garlands are our last farewell. I want them all to feel special. I have a garland saved for you, too. But it’s not a farewell garland. It will be a welcome home garland. Good luck… My friend.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thanks, Ophélie.

speaker: Sophie
line: Oh, Lune’s playing. You two would make a cute couple.

speaker: Gustave
line: If you say so.

speaker: Sophie
line: Or maybe… Something already happened, huh?

speaker: Sophie
line: Sometimes I feel sorry for her.

speaker: Gustave
line: Who, the– The Paintress??

speaker: Sophie
line: Look at her. She looks… sad. Maybe she’s a prisoner too. Stuck in the same cycle with us. Silly, huh?

speaker: Gustave
line: Only you could choose empathy at a moment like this.

speaker: Sophie
line: It’s one of the few choices I can make.

speaker: Gustave
line: I couldn’t do it.

speaker: Sophie
line: It’s ok. You don’t have to.

speaker: Mielle
line: Oh, hi, Sophie.

speaker: Sophie
line: Oh? Mielle? I didn’t expect to see you here.

speaker: Mielle
line: I’m volunteering to help guide children who are losing their parents to the orphanage. Those who were not registered for foster families…

speaker: Sophie
line: How kind of you.

speaker: Mielle
line: I guess I can relate…

speaker: Sophie
line: Take care during the Expedition. Gustave told me a lot of wonderful things about you.

speaker: Mielle
line: About you too. I always told him you two should never have broken up.

speaker: Sophie
line: Look at these orphans, that’s… That’s where we disagreed. But I have hope that you and Gustave will change things, so no one has to go through this impossible choice again.

speaker: Mielle
line: Yeah… Let’s hope we will.

speaker: Sophie
line: See you.

speaker: Mielle
line: In the next life.

speaker: Henri
line: You’d have to be crazy to use Pictos on your own body.

speaker: Sophie
line: Why? Aren’t you enjoying the show?

speaker: Henri
line: Nah, the show’s great, but etching chroma onto your skin? oof, that’s brutal. And just for a dance? I’ll stick to painting Pictos on my machines, I’m not cuckoo enough to put them on my body.

speaker: Sophie
line: Could be useful though, the Expeditions rely on them quite heavily.

speaker: Henri
line: Eh, they’re crazy too. But at least, you can remove Pictos pretty easily if you change your mind.

speaker: Sophie
line: I’ve always loved the Harbour.

speaker: Sophie
line: I see your apprentices.

speaker: Alexandre
line: Gustave! Gustave!

speaker: Gustave
line: What–

speaker: Guillaume
line: Here. Sophie asked us to bring you your coat.

speaker: Alexandre
line: We sewed up the sleeves so you don’t have to keep rolling it up.

speaker: Gustave
line: You guys know how to sew?

speaker: Alexandre
line: Sophie helped us. Turns out, it’s not that hard! You really shoulda done this ages ago.

speaker: Gustave
line: You did this?

speaker: Sophie
line: Gentlemen, that was supposed to be between us, yeah? I wanted to do something. For you.

speaker: Gustave
line: Soph. Thanks, guys, this is– This is great. Thank you.

speaker: Alexandre
line: See you at the festival?

speaker: Guillaume
line: Don’t leave without saying goodbye.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, of course not. What? I know that face.

speaker: Sophie
line: You mean a lot to them. I can tell.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, they mean a lot to me too. Legacy can take many forms, right?

speaker: Sophie
line: Yeah.

speaker: Gustave
line: You taught me that.

speaker: Sophie
line: Hm. Right.

speaker: Gustave
line: Why?

speaker: Sophie
line: I… wanted to see you wearing it.

speaker: Gustave
line: Oh, you like uniforms now?

speaker: Sophie
line: This too is your legacy.

speaker: Gustave
line: In a way, it’s yours too.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m here.

speaker: Sophie
line: I know. I know.

speaker: Lucien
line: There you are! You can’t hide from us, you know. Like I said, mourning’s best done with friends.

speaker: Catherine
line: Lucien.

speaker: Lucien
line: What? It is. Grieving alone is the worst.

speaker: Catherine
line: Where’s mine?

speaker: Lucien
line: Santé, les amis!

speaker: Catherine
line: Santé!

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah– Yeah, yeah, no, I could use a drink.

speaker: Catherine
line: Five tables this year, you see that? Told you we’d beat the 34s. Even Maelle showed up, and she hates these things. Wanna go take a look?

speaker: Gustave
line: Uh, I don’t– Maybe later. I’ll catch up. I’m okay. I’m okay. You go.

speaker: Lucien
line: Yeah. Time for a refill anyway.

speaker: Catherine
line: There’s an “excess of wine” again. Thank your sister for her generosity.

speaker: Lucien
line: Oh, and try to enjoy yourself. Don’t drink alone, you weirdo!

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, right. Enjoy myself. I should check on Maelle, she’s probably alone, as usual. Let’s at least check on Maelle and my apprentices.

speaker: Gustave
line: I knew I’d find you here. Having second thoughts about the Expedition?

speaker: Maelle
line: Please. I’m more ready to go than you are.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I know.

speaker: Gustave
line: I know we’ve been over this, but as your guardian, I need to say this one more time. The rest of us only have a year left, but you’ve got nine good years before your Gommage. You don’t need to leave yet. It’s a lot of risk.

speaker: Maelle
line: One year out there’s better than nine years in here.

speaker: Gustave
line: I know you think that but–

speaker: Maelle
line: If anyone should stay, it’s you. You have friends and family who want you here–

speaker: Gustave
line: So do you–

speaker: Maelle
line: No, I don’t.

speaker: Gustave
line: Emma thinks of you as family–

speaker: Maelle
line: Lumière’s not my home. Not the way it is for you. Besides, this way I can keep an eye on you for Emma.

speaker: Gustave
line: Right, ‘cause she needs eyes everywhere.

speaker: Maelle
line: Shush. You’re lucky you have a sister who cares.

speaker: Gustave
line: Doubly lucky, since now I have two.

speaker: Maelle
line: Alright, enough chit chat. C’mon, old man, let’s have a duel.

speaker: Gustave
line: “Old man?”

speaker: Maelle
line: You’re pretty much the oldest man in Lumière, now, non? C’mon. This time, I’m not messing around! Hope your Lumina Converter works better than your duelling.

speaker: Gustave
line: Not bad for the oldest man in Lumière, eh?

speaker: Maelle
line: Congratulations, you beat a teenager. Take this token as your well deserved prize. Don’t get too drunk tonight, okay?

speaker: Gustave
line: Hmmm, where are my scallywag apprentices? I promised to find them at the festival.

speaker: Jules
line: Wow, so many Expeditioners! So cool!

speaker: Jules
line: That’s… He made that overnight? Dad… Damn, now I feel stupid for fighting with him… Dad…

speaker: Jules
line: You take it.

speaker: Gustave
line: What?

speaker: Jules
line: I’m not sure I’ll ever use it. Maybe I’ll go blind like my father, or maybe another expedition will succeed. I want to support the Expedition now. Take it. It may be useful to you.

speaker: Jules
line: It’s ok. I don’t need the uniform to know my dad’s with me.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thanks.

speaker: Michel
line: Come, let’s play some cards.

speaker: Gustave
line: No way. Everyone knows you cheat.

speaker: Michel
line: That’s just what sore losers say. Come now, you gonna be a little cautious mouse with the Paintress too?

speaker: Gustave
line: “Cautious” is good. Keeps you alive.

speaker: Michel
line: Meh. We’re EXPEDITIONERS. Stay smart, yes, but be BOLD, eh? You can’t win if you don’t play.

speaker: Gustave
line: Money’s no good out there anyway. Why’re you trying to fleece me?

speaker: Michel
line: ‘Cause winning is fun.

speaker: Seba
line: Gustave! Come drink with me!

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m pacing myself tonight.

speaker: Seba
line: Oh, you’re so boring. It’s our last night! Who knows when we’ll be back.

speaker: Gustave
line: I like that you say “when” and not “if.”

speaker: Seba
line: What can I say? I’m an optimist. Or an idiot. Depends on who you ask.

speaker: Tom
line: Hey, Gustave, check out the new Pictos I made!

speaker: Gustave
line: Looks a bit rough. You sure it works?

speaker: Tom
line: I’ve been working on this for months. It’s my personal masterpiece.

speaker: Gustave
line: Your personal masterpiece seems a little… unorthodox.

speaker: Tom
line: It’s dead useful, trust me. C’mon, give it a whirl.

speaker: Gustave
line: Sure, why not…

speaker: Tom
line: Great. I’ll trade it for one token.

speaker: Gustave
line: Call it morbid curiosity. Here. Your token.

speaker: Tom
line: You won’t regret it. Probably.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hey, Amandine, having fun?

speaker: Amandine
line: Oh, hey, handsome, perfect timing. I’m styling everyone before we ship out. Gotta look sharp when we hit the Paintress, eh?

speaker: Gustave
line: Certainly important. Can you style me up too?

speaker: Amandine
line: On it. Just bring me a token first.

speaker: Antoine
line: Gustave, just the man I wanted to see.

speaker: Gustave
line: You want a rematch, don’t you?

speaker: Antoine
line: It’s my last chance, isn’t it?

speaker: Gustave
line: After tomorrow, you’ll be the undisputed expert on Expedition history.

speaker: Antoine
line: That’s tomorrow. What about today?

speaker: Gustave
line: Who am I to deny you. Fire away.

speaker: Antoine
line: How many years ago was the Fracture?

speaker: Gustave
line: You’re kidding, this is your question?

speaker: Antoine
line: Yes. When did our world break apart and our luminous city get thrown into the middle of the ocean? When was the Fracture?

speaker: Gustave
line: 67 years ago.

speaker: Antoine
line: Brilliant. I concede. You are the undisputed expert on Lumieran History.

speaker: Gustave
line: What are you talking about? Every child knows this. The Monolith’s essentially a reverse calendar, counting down since the Fracture happened in Year 100.

speaker: Antoine
line: All right, fine, another one then. Which was the first expedition to depart for the continent?

speaker: Gustave
line: Expedition Zero.

speaker: Antoine
line: Correct. That still annoys me. They left in Year 100. They should be called Expedition 100. Makes no sense. Lumière will be long gone before the Monolith hits zero. Alright, last one. Get it right and maybe I’ll give you a token. What is a “Lumina?”

speaker: Gustave
line: Abilities you internalise by using a Pictos in battle after enough times.

speaker: Antoine
line: Well done, well done.

speaker: Gustave
line: Not really, I mean, I created the Lumina Converter… So…?

speaker: Antoine
line: Ahem. I hereby officially end our feud. With your departure, Lumière loses a brilliant light. And a… good friend.

speaker: Gustave
line: You big softie.

speaker: Antoine
line: Alright, alright, here’s a token, go spend it on something.

speaker: Colette
line: Hello there, Gustave. Perhaps one of these artefacts may prove useful to your mission?

speaker: Gustave
line: Colette, you’ve been holding out on us. What are these?

speaker: Colette
line: Relics from before the Fracture, passed down through the generations. The Council deemed them trinkets, but I think otherwise.

speaker: Gustave
line: That’s kind of you to share.

speaker: Colette
line: I may not be able to join the Expedition, but I’d still like to help. One token is all I ask.

speaker: Gustave
line: Ah. I should’ve known.

speaker: Gustave
line: These are yours?

speaker: Sciel
line: You gonna lecture ME on drinking?

speaker: Gustave
line: I wouldn’t dare. Just calculating how much it’ll hurt to catch up.

speaker: Sciel
line: You can start now. Here, let’s have a toast. To Sophie. Who was always… unapologetically Sophie. My fierce and loving friend.

speaker: Gustave
line: To Soph. Seriously, though, this is gonna hurt tomorrow.

speaker: Sciel
line: Mmmm. “Tomorrow comes” but I ain’t here yet. I’m not crossing the sea sober.

speaker: Gustave
line: Sober’s better than deathly hungover.

speaker: Sciel
line: No, not for that.

speaker: Gustave
line: Ah.

speaker: Sciel
line: Go have some drinks.

speaker: Gustave
line: Commander.

speaker: Alan
line: Gustave. Saw you with Sophie. You talked?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah. I– Yeah. Where’s your daughter?

speaker: Alan
line: Léona’s upset. Doesn’t want to see me.

speaker: Gustave
line: Shit.

speaker: Alan
line: It’s ok. She doesn’t need to understand. As long as she gets to live.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah.

speaker: Alan
line: I’m counting on you.

speaker: Gustave
line: No pressure.

speaker: Alan
line: Oh, no. LOTS of pressure. You and Lune and your Lumina tech. That’s our edge.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m– Thanks, but– That’s not– Everyone has a role. Lucien, Tristan, Catherine. And YOU. You made us into a– We have a really good team, thanks to you. That’s our edge.

speaker: Alan
line: “Tomorrow comes,” my friend.

speaker: Gustave
line: Doesn’t it always.

speaker: Jérôme
line: Think there’s other survivor out there?

speaker: Gustave
line: Doubtful. We would’ve seen signs.

speaker: Jérôme
line: But not impossible. Maybe if they have Shield Domes. But they would’ve been overrun by Nevrons before they could be any.

speaker: Gustave
line: We were lucky the Fracture dropped us out here. Bought us time to get our defences up.

speaker: Jérôme
line: I dunno. People are resourceful. And Nevrons can’t be everywhere. I’m betting on human ingenuity.

speaker: Gustave
line: I like that.

speaker: Gustave
line: You came.

speaker: Lucie
line: I wasn’t sure if I should.

speaker: Gustave
line: You’ve been avoiding us. You didn’t have to.

speaker: Lucie
line: Mm. I heard Seba filled my spot. After I left.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah.

speaker: Lucie
line: D’you think I’m a coward for staying?

speaker: Gustave
line: Do you?

speaker: Lucie
line: Not anymore. Not all of us can change the world. Some of us can only change ourselves.

speaker: Gustave
line: Meaning what? Make yourself accept the unacceptable? Make believe that happiness is… this?

speaker: Lucie
line: More like… rediscover. Happiness. One Gommage left. Maybe contentment is the highest form of happiness.

speaker: Gustave
line: It makes me sad to hear you talk like this. The Paintress stole so many things, including your capacity to dream.

speaker: Lucie
line: No, you misunderstand. My mind is where I can be free. She can’t touch me there. This is my final act of defiance. Just like the Expedition is yours.

speaker: Gustave
line: If you say so.

speaker: Tristan
line: I just finished calibrating the Lumina Converter. We can launch test runs as soon as we land.

speaker: Gustave
line: Perfect.

speaker: Tristan
line: Hey. Does Lune seem preoccupied to you? She’s been distant lately.

speaker: Gustave
line: Well. It’s Lune.

speaker: Tristan
line: Mm. This feels different.

speaker: Gustave
line: I haven’t noticed anything, but you know her better. Have you talked to her?

speaker: Tristan
line: Nah, she doesn’t like people prying. I’ve known her since we were six. She hates personal questions.

speaker: Gustave
line: Ah right, you were both apprenticed to her parents.

speaker: Tristan
line: Yeaahh. Let’s just say, they ran a tight ship.

speaker: Gustave
line: Mmm. I can imagine.

speaker: Bastien
line: Ready for tomorrow?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah– Been ready. What about you? Heard you were elected “Commander 32.” Congrats.

speaker: Bastien
line: I’ve already claimed Alan’s office. It’s got a nicer view than mine.

speaker: Gustave
line: A view of the Paintress? You’re sicker than I thought.

speaker: Bastien
line: She won’t be there for long.

speaker: Gustave
line: Mmmm. If we– If we fail though…

speaker: Bastien
line: “When one falls, we continue.” We’ll pick up, and we’ll push on. But I know. We will meet again.

speaker: Gustave
line: I can’t believe you’re working right now.

speaker: Lune
line: Mm. Tristan dragged me here.

speaker: Gustave
line: Is that the final spot? It’s amazing you triangulated Expedition Zero’s landing site.

speaker: Lune
line: Theoretically. I extrapolated from the archives, but… it was 67 years ago. So much of the landscape has changed.

speaker: Gustave
line: I trust your calculations.

speaker: Lune
line: Thanks.

speaker: Gustave
line: It’s a good strategy, retracing their steps. They’re the only expedition with any survivors, and they made it to the Monolith so…

speaker: Lune
line: Assuming the records are correct, my calculations are correct, that they left clear markers, that the road conditions haven’t changed–

speaker: Gustave
line: You need a drink.

speaker: Lune
line: Go away, Gustave.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hey.

speaker: Catherine
line: Hey yourself. You ok? Wanna talk about it?

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, umm. Actually, no.

speaker: Catherine
line: That’s ok.

speaker: Gustave
line: What about you? You say goodbye to Derrick?

speaker: Catherine
line: Oh, that was over ages ago.

speaker: Gustave
line: Oh. Sorry–

speaker: Catherine
line: Eh.

speaker: Gustave
line: –I really thought you guys would work out.

speaker: Catherine
line: It’s for the best. I need full focus on the Expedition. And our team. We’re all we have.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, we’re all we have.

speaker: Lucien
line: Glass of wine? Or a hug?

speaker: Gustave
line: Keep your sweat to yourself.

speaker: Lucien
line: Bring Gustave a glass of wine!

speaker: Gustave
line: Who, exactly, are you talking to? They cut servers from the budget years ago.

speaker: Lucien
line: Ah. The ultimate indignity. A farewell party where we serve ourselves. There’s a metaphor in there somewhere.

speaker: Gustave
line: Mmmm. I’m betting you’ve got another bottle stashed in your coat somewhere. You gonna share?

speaker: Lucien
line: You wound me. But yes, in fact, I do have a bottle. “Always be prepared.” Or was it “Always bring backup?” Eh. Same difference.

speaker: Gustave
line: Right.

speaker: Lucien
line: And I AM prepared! Prepared to live. AND. Prepared to die.

speaker: Gustave
line: You’re such an idiot.

speaker: Lucien
line: Hey. Heyheyheyheyhey. We’ve got your Lumina Converter, yeah? I. BELIEVE. I’m ready for my Lumina!

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, well, we’ve only tested it here. Who knows what we’ll meet on the main continent. We’ll need more field-testing once we land.

speaker: Lucien
line: Don’t worry, buddy. I’ve got you covered.

speaker: Gustave
line: Great. Thanks, buddy.

speaker: Alexandre
line: Gustave! We got something for you. For your field notes. So when you come back, you can tell us EVERYTHING. They’ll definitely want that for the Museum! The complete record of the Expedition that DESTROYED the Paintress!

speaker: Guillaume
line: Oh, and if you find journals from the other Expeditions, make sure you save them for us!

speaker: Gustave
line: I shall faithfully record ALL of our adventures. Every strange and wondrous thing.

speaker: Alexandre
line: And Nevrons!

speaker: Gustave
line: I can do that. And in return, do you solemnly promise to take care of the Shield Dome while I’m gone? I’m entrusting you with the safety of Lumière.

speaker: Alexandre
line: I promise.

speaker: Guillaume
line: Promise!

speaker: Gustave
line: Adrien?

speaker: Adrien
line: I’ll use everything you taught us, Monsieur G.

speaker: Alexandre
line: Oh, hey, Gustave, your sister’s here!

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I have to go talk to her. Take care of each other.

speaker: Gustave
line: My darling sister has arrived, she’ll kill me if I don’t say goodbye. The Chief Councilor honours us with her presence. What? You still mad I’m going?

speaker: Emma
line: This is the definition of a fool’s quest, and my brother’s not usually a fool.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’ve heard you say otherwise.

speaker: Emma
line: You and I both know the political complexities that necessitate the Expedition. It’s vital for morale, but it’s a bloodless guillotine, is what it is–

speaker: Gustave
line: You should put that in your speech. Very motivating. They might just find a guillotine for you too.

speaker: Emma
line: There are so many things you can contribute to HERE, in Lumière. That’ll have a REAL impact.

speaker: Gustave
line: Em. You’re doing great work– Really. Getting things ready for the Last Generation– You’ve got it well in-hand here. Let me do my part, out there, and win us a chance to LIVE.

speaker: Emma
line: We’re never going to see each other again.

speaker: Gustave
line: Don’t you have a speech to give?

speaker: Emma
line: You mean the one you so kindly wrote to me?

speaker: Gustave
line: Just suggestions! I thought it might help you understand–

speaker: Emma
line: I do. Understand. I just– Anyway. Yeah, time for my speech.

speaker: Emma
line: Expeditioners. The Sword of Lumière. We honour your dedication. We do not take for granted that you dedicate your final year of life to keeping hope alive for all of Lumière. Some of you are leaving to change the world. Others to discover the secrets of our universe. Some to protect loved ones. Others to find meaning in our all-too-short lives. As you sail into the unknown, know that Lumière stands with you. When you battle the Paintress, know that Lumière fights with you. Let the stones of her Monolith crumble. Let her body lie at the end of the world, unable to paint another death. Let the stars no longer be hidden by her oppressive silhouette. Let the world once again watch the sun rise without the shadow of her cursed figure. May the wind of renewal take you to the ends of the earth. Tomorrow comes. Thanks to you, Expedition 33.

speaker: Alan
line: Get ready. You– You’re old. How did you– How did you survive the Gommage? Which expedition are you fr–

speaker: Jérôme
line: FALL BACK!

speaker: Lucien
line: MERDE! GUSTAVE, COME ON! WE NEED TO GO! He’s not following– PUTAIN– What the fuck– Who the FUCK was that?

speaker: Margot
line: MERDE. What do we do now?

speaker: Tristan
line: Regroup at the Rally Point. The Indigo Tre–

speaker: Lucien
line: Fuck! RUN!

speaker: Margot
line: NOOOO

speaker: Margot
line: (scream)

speaker: Lucien
line: Keep going! COME ON! MOVE! FUCKING SNAP OUT OF–

speaker: Lune
line: You do that, we both die. Hey. Fucking hell. Wake up, Gustave.

speaker: Gustave
line: Lune– The others–

speaker: Lune
line: I know. We’re the only ones left. You don’t get to die.

speaker: Gustave
line: It’s just a matter of time, before we– “We’re already dead.” Look around– Look– Look–

speaker: Lune
line: This is not a foregone conclusion. “When one falls, we continue.” GET UP. We need to find a safer place, there are Nevrons around.

speaker: Gustave
line: Lucien– I couldn’t–

speaker: Lune
line: This is not the place… The Lumina Converter seems intact. It’s about time we test it in real conditions.

speaker: Gustave
line: Putain… Putain…

speaker: Lune
line: We did it, Gustave. Let’s see if your invention lives up to its reputation, shall we? It really works. We’re not dead yet.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah.

speaker: Lune
line: Come on. There might be other survivors at the Indigo Tree.

speaker: Lune
line: Someone came here before and set up these handholds.

speaker: Gustave
line: Probably Expedition 69, the climbers expedition.

speaker: Lune
line: Let us thank them for that.

speaker: Jar
line: (gibberish) (weepy mumble)

speaker: Lune
line: Something’s wrong with it. Why isn’t it attacking us?

speaker: Gustave
line: Well, it certainly attacked them. An expedition journal… 81. “Learn from the ones who came before…”

speaker: Lune
line: “… And lay the trail, for the ones who come after.”

speaker: Lune
line: They communicate with a Nevron?

speaker: Gustave
line: The dead here don’t disappear, like in Lumière. Their chroma stays inside their bodies.

speaker: Lune
line: On the beach… some did disappear.

speaker: Gustave
line: He wasn’t a Nevron.

speaker: Lune
line: Something about the way Nevrons kill seems to affect our chroma…

speaker: Gustave
line: Perhaps your friend here can enlighten us.

speaker: Jar
line: (gibberish) Enlighten… Light… I need light…

speaker: Gustave
line: It really does speak.

speaker: Lune
line: What do you mean, light?

speaker: Gustave
line: Did you kill these people?

speaker: Jar
line: (gibberish) I would never plunge others into darkness. I was painted to bring light.

speaker: Lune
line: Painted? By the Paintress?

speaker: Jar
line: (gibberish) Paint-tress? Yes. She painted me. Help me… Find light.

speaker: Lune
line: If we bring it light, perhaps we can learn more…

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m not sure that’s a good idea…

speaker: Lune
line: Flares!

speaker: Gustave
line: Survivors!

speaker: Lune
line: Hurry!

speaker: Gustave
line: LEO!

speaker: Lune
line: Fuck, it’s big. Fall back!

speaker: Gustave
line: Putain de merde!

speaker: Lune
line: Celebrate later. There’ll be others. We should be safe up in the tree.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah. PUTAIN. Nobody.

speaker: Lune
line: Wait. There’s a message on the wall—“Took Maelle to the weird corals. Head north. Look for a door inside a hut.”

speaker: Gustave
line: Maelle?

speaker: Lune
line: This doesn’t make sense. Who would have written this? It sounds like an Expeditioner, but everyone KNOWS to sign their messages.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, but they might’ve been in a hurry.

speaker: Lune
line: I dunno. Doesn’t sound like anyone on the team. What if it’s a trap? The man on the beach–

speaker: Gustave
line: It’s a lead, our only lead. Whoever this is knows Maelle. We have to go.

speaker: Lune
line: No, not yet. Protocol is to regroup at the Rally Point and wait three days. This message feels off. If it was an Expeditioner, they would have stayed here. Everyone knows the protocol.

speaker: Gustave
line: Right, but they may have been in danger. Maybe this location has been compromised. Things change in the field.

speaker: Lune
line: There’s a REASON it’s protocol.

speaker: Gustave
line: Protocol doesn’t cover every contingency. You know that.

speaker: Lune
line: There’s a REASON it’s protocol. We designed it to yield the optimal result in the vast majority of situations.

speaker: Gustave
line: Was our entire team dying part of that “optimal result?” Look. I’m going after Maelle. Protocol also states “Never move solo.” I’ll let you choose which protocol to break.

speaker: Lune
line: Merde.

speaker: Lune
line: So. The message said head north. To the “weird corals.”

speaker: Gustave
line: And a door in a hut.

speaker: Lune
line: It’s been a long day, we should make camp.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m fine. Let’s keep going.

speaker: Lune
line: We won’t find Maelle if we’re dead.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m sorry about earlier. The beach was not your fault–

speaker: Lune
line: No, it was. I convinced Alan to land there.

speaker: Gustave
line: So, uh… We can rest a bit, but the moon is bright, I want to keep moving.

speaker: Lune
line: Have you learned nothing from the beach?

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m not leaving Maelle alone a minute longer than I have to.

speaker: Lune
line: But right now, it’s just the two of us and I don’t want to bring Maelle your corpse. We have to think every step through. The man on the beach, you saw what he did. But more than that… You saw his face. He must be, what, 50? 60? Yet he survived the Gommage. We don’t know who we’re dealing with. We lost everyone in an instant–

speaker: Gustave
line: Exactly. He killed us all so easily, he doesn’t need to fake a message. Lucien– Lucien died to save me. And, and Tristan, Margot, they… they all… I am not letting Maelle die out here. I’m taking her home.

speaker: Lune
line: What, No, no, no. We have a mission–

speaker: Gustave
line: Oh, fuck the mission! Fuck the mission, Lune. What are we gonna do, huh? Tell me. What are we gonna do? We’re gonna take down the Paintress, just the three of us? My… my gun and… and your sparks?

speaker: Lune
line: I didn’t take you for a coward.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m not a coward.

speaker: Lune
line: You swore the oath. “When one falls. We. Continue.”

speaker: Gustave
line: Yes, I know.

speaker: Lune
line: When one falls. WHEN one falls. Not if. When. We knew not all of us would make it. But “WE. CONTINUE.” As long as even one of us stands, our fight is not over.

speaker: Gustave
line: But I’m not afraid to fight, it’s just Maelle, she’s–

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle swore the same oath.

speaker: Gustave
line: I know that!

speaker: Lune
line: She chose her life! You and I… Come on… we always said the future of Lumière is more important than any–

speaker: Gustave
line: Than any individual life, yes.

speaker: Lune
line: Yes, do you still believe that? Do you still believe that? Do you?

speaker: Gustave
line: I hope I do.

speaker: Lune
line: “Fuck the mission.” Really?

speaker: Gustave
line: Sorry.

speaker: Gustave
line: 68. Elodie’s expedition.

speaker: Lune
line: You know the commanders of every expedition?

speaker: Gustave
line: Expedition 68. Their boat was blown into the air by a storm. Lumière lost sight of it, but assumed they crashed on the continent.

speaker: Lune
line: And they survived. The storm, at least.

speaker: Gustave
line: Alright, let’s keep moving. We’ve found the “weird corals.” Maelle must be close by.

speaker: Gustave
line: Over there! A hut.

speaker: Lune
line: Slow down, we don’t know what’s inside yet.

speaker: Gustave
line: Look, there’s a door inside.

speaker: Lune
line: Seems empty. Let’s go. Someone lives her– Fuck!

speaker: Lune
line: Where are we? This is–

speaker: Gustave
line: MAELLE!

speaker: Gustave
line: Maelle?

speaker: Maelle
line: Gustave? Are you real? Ooof. Well, you sure smell real enough.

speaker: Gustave
line: No, I don’t. I’m sorry. I thought that y– On the beach, I saw you and I… I couldn’t… I’m sorry, I’m so sorry. I shoul– I should’ve– I should’ve come for you, and…

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s okay. It’s okay. We made it.

speaker: Gustave
line: I was worried.

speaker: Lune
line: How did you end up here?

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t know– It’s all a blur. I remember everyone at the beach. Then I woke up here. With– with him. He’s been helping me a lot. He reinforced all my Pictos.

speaker: Lune
line: What is he?

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m not sure, he doesn’t really talk.

speaker: Lune
line: The chroma around him. It’s… it’s quite different from the Nevrons.

speaker: Maelle
line: How did you find me?

speaker: Gustave
line: There was a message at the Indigo Tree.

speaker: Lune
line: Do you know who left it?

speaker: Maelle
line: A message? Maybe… No, I don’t know.

speaker: The Curator
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Maelle
line: Again? We just trained earlier!

speaker: The Curator
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Maelle
line: Alright, alright. But this time, I have backup!

speaker: The Curator
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Maelle
line: That was fun, but I think we’ve had enough training today.

speaker: The Curator
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Maelle
line: You could come with us, if you like?

speaker: The Curator
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Maelle
line: If that’s a yes, we’ll see you at the camp.

speaker: The Curator
line: (gibberish) …

speaker: Lune
line: … the manor and maybe learn something…

speaker: Gustave
line: … yeah, or we could get back to the Indigo Tree…

speaker: Maelle
line: Huh, Noco’s usually here, I wonder where–

speaker: Lune
line: Is that– A Gestral??

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) INTRUDERS! Oh, Verso would NOT be pleased. EN GARDE, RUFFIANTS!

speaker: Maelle
line: Stop that, you big hairy brush face. Can’t you see they’re human? Noco’s a bit dramatic. But if you’re nice, Noco will trade you lots of useful items for chroma.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Hrmph. I don’t just trade with ANYONE. Only WORTHY WARRIORS! Are you worthy, moustache man?? Hmm, although, I do like that brush on your face.

speaker: Lune
line: So the tales are true– Perhaps the Grandis and the Esquie exist too? Are there more gestrals, like you? I’d love to meet them.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Maybe.

speaker: Maelle
line: Noco, you silly scruff! Their village is not far from here.

speaker: Lune
line: Oh, really?

speaker: Gustave
line: Lune?

speaker: Lune
line: I know. We don’t have time for detours.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, we need to get to the Paintress.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) The Paintress? How you gonna cross the sea? You’re so slow. And you have no fins.

speaker: Lune
line: There’s another sea between here and the Paintress?

speaker: Maelle
line: Noco, as the BEST Gestral merchant ever, I bet you know a solution? Yeah?

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Mmmmmm. Maybe.

speaker: Maelle
line: COME ON, you broomhead. I know you know.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Ahaha, broomhead, that’s good! Excellent, excellent insult! Ok, ok, ask Golgra. Chef has the answer, just go to the Village. In the middle of our Ancient Sanctuary. Red trees everywhere, can’t miss it!

speaker: Gustave
line: Well, I guess you’ll get to meet more Gestrals.

speaker: Lune
line: These dead Nevrons– Who could’ve done this?

speaker: Maelle
line: Guess.

speaker: Gustave
line: So you didn’t just stay in your mansion. Guess we found 68’s boat.

speaker: Maelle
line: There’s a path through the boat.

speaker: Lune
line: That anchor doesn’t look man made…

speaker: Gustave
line: So many– I don’t like this– Merde. This one is gigantic–

speaker: Maelle
line: Avoid those at all costs.

speaker: Lune
line: Watch out!

speaker: Gustave
line: You alright?

speaker: Lune
line: It only attacked when–

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s coming!

speaker: Lune
line: Gustave, wait! It seems peaceful, as long as we don’t touch the flowers.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, well, let’s not get too sentimental. It’s still a Paintress creation. PUTAIN! Damn, Maelle, what was that?

speaker: Maelle
line: It felt… familiar, somehow…

speaker: Lune
line: Gustave. We won’t understand what’s going on if we kill everything that moves.

speaker: Maelle
line: Look, a red tree. The Gestral village must be ahead.

speaker: Gustave
line: You know what Nevrons are capable of.

speaker: Lune
line: She’ll be fine.

speaker: Gustave
line: She’ll be fine.

speaker: Gustave
line: Still too far…

speaker: Maelle
line: Being out here isn’t what I expected.

speaker: Gustave
line: As expected. Hey, you okay?

speaker: Maelle
line: Death out here’s not like death in Lumière, is it? I– uh, I thought I was used to losing people. Like of a foster child, right? But not– not like that– on the beach… that man…

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah… yeah, I know… Neurons, we were prepared for, but not… And now, we finally found other survivors and it’s… You know, that’s… that’s the insidious thing about the Gommage. It’s predictable. Almost gentle. It makes Lumière complacent and accepting but… The Gommage is equally violent and death… Death is just as final.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’ve been having nightmares.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, me too… Look, If death approaches, I want you to run. No, no, no. Promise me. Run. Especially if we meet the man from the beach. We can’t face him. You see him, you run.

speaker: Maelle
line: Only if you do the same.

speaker: Gustave
line: Oh, I’m running as soon as I see a strand of white hair. Trust me. You won’t even see me, I’m running so fast.

speaker: Maelle
line: Oh, please. You’re an old man, I can outrun you any day…

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, right… There was a time when thirsty was young, you know…

speaker: Maelle
line: Huh, sure…

speaker: Maelle
line: Surprised to find you here.

speaker: Lune
line: I hope we can trust him.

speaker: Maelle
line: Well, at least, we can upgrade our Pictos.

speaker: Gustave
line: Been a long time since I’ve seen you play.

speaker: Lune
line: A Gestral village–

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah. I still can’t believe they exist. I mean, what other fairy tales are real?

speaker: Lune
line: This is ultimately a war of information. But there’s still too much we don’t understand. Where the Paintress comes from? Why she does what she does? Who is she?? Seventy years and we still barely know anything.

speaker: Gustave
line: And the man on the beach. Yeah, too many unknowns. But, if we take down the Paintress, at least that gives future generations a chance to unravel the mystery.

speaker: Lune
line: You seem better than– before.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah? I’m holding it together?

speaker: Lune
line: Mm.

speaker: Gustave
line: Shock’s worn off. A bit. We can’t bring anyone back. But I thought we can keep their spirit alive by pushing forward. And at least, there’s three of us now. The mission hasn’t changed.

speaker: Lune
line: Tomorrow comes.

speaker: Gustave
line: Tomorrow comes.

speaker: Lune
line: Did Noco tell you anything about the village, other than “red trees everywhere?”

speaker: Maelle
line: Noco’s not great with specifics.

speaker: Gustave
line: We’ll just have to think like Gestrals then.

speaker: Maelle
line: That’s a lot of red trees to search–

speaker: Lune
line: They must have some sort of track or trail leading to the village.

speaker: Gustave
line: Wait, I heard something. It might be Nevrons. Be careful, okay?

speaker: Maelle
line: Wow…

speaker: Gustave
line: That’s a lot of dead Nevrons.

speaker: Lune
line: Who did th–
(gibberish) NEVRON! ALERT! NEVRON! ALERT!

speaker: Gustave
line: I don’t see any–

speaker: Lune
line: I think they mean us.

speaker: Maelle
line: They must be Gestrals! They’re cute, but they’re idiots.

speaker: Gustave
line: Oh, fucking– Hey, hey, we’re NOT Nevrons!

speaker: Maelle
line: Don’t worry, we don’t want to hurt you, Patate. Noco sent us.

speaker: Karatom
line: (gibberish) Our Sakapatate was supposed to be INVINCIBLE. Wait– Noco sent you? OH! DID NOCO SEND YOU TO HELP US BUILD A BETTER SAKAPATATE?!

speaker: Lune
line: If you guide us to your village–

speaker: Karatom
line: (gibberish) OOOOOH, what’s this? Cool. Ok, deal! Give me the arm for our Sakapatate and I’ll show you the village.

speaker: Maelle
line: Guide us to your village, and maybe, he’ll make you something better.

speaker: Gustave
line: Wait, what d’you–

speaker: Karatom
line: (gibberish) How do I know you’re not lying?

speaker: Maelle
line: Trust me, I hate liars.

speaker: Karatom
line: (gibberish) Mmmmmmm. OK DEAL! Follow me. There are lots more Sakapatates. You’ll be fine, just don’t die.

speaker: Gustave
line: You’re better with Gestrals than humans.

speaker: Maelle
line: They’re less complicated.

speaker: Tropa
line: (gibberish) INTRUDER ALERT! INTRUDER ALERT! Send forth the ULTIMATE WEAPON!

speaker: Peron
line: (gibberish) But they’re human.

speaker: Tropa
line: (gibberish) Shhh. Now’s our chance to test the Ultimate Sakapatate in a REAL fight.

speaker: Peron
line: (gibberish) Oh, yeah, so cool, so cool!

speaker: Gustave
line: They sound like kids.

speaker: Lune
line: We must be getting close to the Village.

speaker: Tropa
line: (gibberish) En garde, warriors! Face our ULTIMATE CREATION!

speaker: Maelle
line: Kinda looks the same as all the others.

speaker: Karatom
line: (gibberish) Those were supposed to be invincible, but this one is even MORE invincible.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hey, don’t get cocky, Maelle. Look at its equipment. That looks a lot more dangerous than the others. No, seriously.

speaker: Peron
line: (gibberish) This Sakapatate is GARBAGE!

speaker: Karatom
line: (gibberish) Oh, you’re good! Chef’s definitely gonna wanna meet you.

speaker: Maelle
line: Chef?

speaker: Karatom
line: (gibberish) Golgra: The BEST FIGHTER of ALL the Gestrals EVER, alive OR hibernating. Golgra will wanna see you right away. Let’s go!

speaker: Lune
line: It’s… it’s really a village of Gestrals!

speaker: Gustave
line: They seem better at surviving than humans.

speaker: Maelle
line: I guess intelligence is not a prerequisite for survival on the continent. Now to find the chief’s house. Probably the biggest one.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) So YOU’RE the warriors who demolished our ULTIMATE Sakapatate?

speaker: Maelle
line: It wasn’t that strong.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Hmmmm. I see. Well. You’ve earned my respect. What can I do for you?

speaker: Lune
line: Are you the “Chef?”

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) I am indeed the “Chef” of our village. The name’s Golgra.

speaker: Lune
line: There are so many questions I’d love to ask–

speaker: Gustave
line: We need to get to the Paintress. Noco said you could help us cross the sea?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Humans. Still so obsessed with the Paintress.

speaker: Lune
line: Others have passed through here?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) A few of your expeditions, every few years. Hard to keep track. Hmmm. Do you not have your own boat? How did you get here in the first place?

speaker: Lune
line: A white-haired man destroyed it.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) And you survived? My respect.

speaker: Lune
line: You know him?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) He attacked the village once. Some of us survived. Somehow. Mmm. Ok. You have no boat. In that case, your best bet is Esquie. If you ask nicely, maybe Esquie can take you across the water.

speaker: Lune
line: So Esquie exists!

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Of course! Esquie lives not far from here. But only the greatest warriors are allowed through. You need a password.

speaker: Maelle
line: Why?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Esquie is very friendly, but Esquie could also accidentally eat you. Esquie doesn’t know its own strength sometimes. It would be irresponsible to let weaklings visit Esquie.

speaker: Maelle
line: We already defeated your Ultimate Sakapatate.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Not. Good. Enough. You’ll have to enter our Legendary Tournament to get the password. This is the Gestral way. You will be fighting our Legendary Warriors. They are old so it should be easy.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Now I’m excited. Let’s see what you can do. Oh, and you’ll also fight the Stranger. Yeah, that will be fun.

speaker: Lune
line: The Stranger?

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Okay, enough talk. Go fight now. Do you want to go to the arena directly or do you want to beat up a few gestrals around here first?

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait– That’s–

speaker: Gustave
line: Sciel?

speaker: Sciel
line: What– How– You guys– You’re alive! I thought I was the only one left– I knew you were resourceful.

speaker: Lune
line: How did you get here?

speaker: Gestral announcer
line: (gibberish) Hey, humans! We’re here to see some fighting! If you don’t wanna fight, we’ll come down and fight ourselves!

speaker: Sciel
line: They’re expecting a bit of a show. Shall we?

speaker: Maelle
line: Well, that wasn’t so bad.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, really just felt like beating old people.

speaker: Maelle
line: So it wasn’t so bad.

speaker: Sciel
line: Am I one of those old people?

speaker: Gustave
line: One day, I hope. Hey, how’d you end up here?

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh, um. After the beach– I ended up in an odd yellow forest, not too far from here. Had to dodge a few Nevrons. But luckily, I met a Gestral who guided me here. What about you?

speaker: Gustave
line: Um… Well, I– I woke up near to a waterfall and–

speaker: Lune
line: We can talk later. Let’s go back to Golgra.

speaker: Gustave
line: No time to lose.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) You return as champions. Well done, well done. Ok then, you ready? The password is– “Get outta my way.”

speaker: Maelle
line: The password is “get outta my way?”

speaker: Sciel
line: Very gestral-ish.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Esquie’s Nest is east of the Village. Sunniso guards the path. Shout the password as loud as you can and Sunniso will let you through.

speaker: Sciel
line: “As loud as we can.” Got it.

speaker: Gustave
line: Thank you. For everything.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) Try not to die too soon.

speaker: Maelle
line: Gestral positivity is so heart-warming.

speaker: Golgra
line: (gibberish) One more thing. We’ve opened the back door for you. It’ll be easier to come back and visit us.

speaker: Sciel
line: Thanks, Chief.

speaker: Sciel
line: I still can’t believe it. I lost hope after a while, but you all survived.

speaker: Gustave
line: What was your plan if we hadn’t? Be a gestral champion until your Gommage?

speaker: Sciel
line: Well, it was a lot of fun so, yeah, maybe?

speaker: Lune
line: Noco’s quite obsessed with your arm. Your apprentices will be extremely proud knowing a Gestral loves their work.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, they’d be insanely excited.

speaker: Lune
line: Well, they did a great job designing your arm. It was quite a creative assignement you gave them.

speaker: Gustave
line: Well, when life gives you lemons…

speaker: Lune
line: Losing an arm is quite a lemon.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, it’s not limonade.

speaker: Lune
line: (laughs)

speaker: Gustave
line: You okay? You’ve been quiet since we left the Village.

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah. Sorry… Bad memories.

speaker: Gustave
line: Wanna talk about it?

speaker: Sciel
line: Hm, no.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hm, nah…

speaker: Sciel
line: I’m glad you’re here.

speaker: Gustave
line: I would never abandon a member of Aquafarm 3.

speaker: Sciel
line: Aquafarm 3. That was so long ago. You and Sophie were inseparable on that project.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, we were.

speaker: Sciel
line: It was a good project. It fed so many neighbourhoods at once. Kinda nostalgic, thinking back. We really thought we were making a difference.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hey, we’re still making a différence.

speaker: Sciel
line: Yes. Of course!

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah…

speaker: Sciel
line: I can’t believe it. We’re gonna meet THE Esquie.

speaker: Lune
line: The Gestrals. And Esquie. The tales are true.

speaker: Maelle
line: Do you feel someth– White hair… Who are you?

speaker: White-haired man
line: Alicia. I told you to stay home. It’s not good for you to see this. Yes. Yes, I understand. It’s her fault and she doesn’t even know it. But you can’t be here.

speaker: Maelle
line: What are you talking about? What’s my fault?! What is this?!

speaker: White-haired man
line: You should never have come. You’re only going to make things worse. For everyone. Now take your friends and go home. Let them spend their final year in peace. This is your only warning.

speaker: Sciel
line: I can’t wait to see–

speaker: Gustave
line: Maelle? Hey, hey, hey…

speaker: Maelle
line: It was him! It was him! The white-haired man– and this woman–

speaker: Gustave
line: Wai– Where– What are you talking about?

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle, breathe. Slow down. What did you see? Think carefully. Every detail could be important.

speaker: Maelle
line: He said– He said we need to go… home. And that it’s– It’s my fault? That I’m– I’m gonna make things… worse. For everyone. You were all– frozen. I couldn’t– I couldn’t– It was like– a waking nightmare.

speaker: Gustave
line: It’s ok, it’s ok, it’s over.

speaker: Lune
line: What else? You said there was a woman?

speaker: Sciel
line: Lune, maybe later.

speaker: Maelle
line: She– She had a mask– And–

speaker: Lune
line: I know this is hard, but I need you to focus, okay? While the details are fresh.

speaker: Gustave
line: Lune. Ask her tomorrow. Hey, hey. Breathe. Silent to me. You’re safe. Do you understand? Okay? It’s over.

speaker: Gustave
line: Feeling better?

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah–

speaker: Lune
line: We can debrief along the way. Let’s head east to Esquie’s Nest.

speaker: Sunniso
line: Oh, hi, little humans, you need the password to enter.

speaker: Sciel
line: Golgra said to shout the password “as loud as we can.” Well, Gustave, you’re the loudest.

speaker: Gustave
line: Really? Hey.

speaker: Sciel
line: Come on, don’t be shy.

speaker: Gustave
line: Ahem. GET OUTTA MY WAY.

speaker: Sunniso
line: Geez, you don’t need to be so rude.

speaker: Gustave
line: Nonononono, uh… it’s just… um… it’s the password…

speaker: Sunniso
line: Well, I don’t know! Golgra never told me the password. But whatever, just go in.

speaker: Gustave
line: Look. I am very sorry. It’s just that Golgra told us that’s the password and I–

speaker: Maelle
line: Come on, it’s a Gestral, he’ll have forgotten in about a minute.

speaker: Gustave
line: I’m sorry.

speaker: Sciel
line: Interesting decor.

speaker: Lune
line: Esquie is said to feed on light.

speaker: Gustave
line: Are you ok, Maelle?

speaker: Maelle
line: I dunno. Getting a bit of … déjà vu again.

speaker: Sciel
line: The light here– Feels a little– I dunno– Yeah.

speaker: Lune
line: Hmmm, no Esquie–

speaker: Esquie
line: WOOOOOOOOOOOH! Bonjour, mes amis.

speaker: Sciel
line: Hey. Bonjour, mon ami.

speaker: Lune
line: Sciel.

speaker: Sciel
line: What? I dunno, he seems nice.

speaker: Esquie
line: Oh! It’s you! Hello again, my terrible swimmer friend. You’ve finally come to learn to swim!

speaker: Sciel
line: No? Uh. I’m not– I’m not that fond of water.

speaker: Gustave
line: Uh. Actually, that’s sort of why we’re here. We need to cross the sea. Golgra said you could help?

speaker: Esquie
line: Mon ami! “A rolling stone gathers no moss.”

speaker: Lune
line: Pardon me?

speaker: Sciel
line: In the stories, they say Esquie like to speak in riddles.

speaker: Esquie
line: In what way?

speaker: Gustave
line: I don’t get it.

speaker: Esquie
line: OHOHO!

speaker: Lune
line: We really need to cross the sea. Would you help us?

speaker: Esquie
line: Mmm. There’s a lot of you to carry. I’m strong. But I’m not that strong. I will need Florrie.

speaker: Sciel
line: Who’s Florrie?

speaker: Esquie
line: One of my rocks!

speaker: Maelle
line: Rocks?

speaker: Esquie
line: See, Florrie helps me swim. But Florrie was stolen by my archnemesis! The one whose every step SHAKES the foundation of the world! The one known as… François.

speaker: Lune
line: Ok.

speaker: Gustave
line: Let me guess. François is located deep in Nevron-infected territory, right?

speaker: Esquie
line: Oh, no, he’s right next door. Over there!

speaker: Gustave
line: Oh.

speaker: Esquie
line: François is my neighbour.

speaker: Gustave
line: Okay… Well, I guess we could take a look–

speaker: Esquie
line: FAN-TASTIC! Good luck, mes amis! Please, bring Florrie back to me.

speaker: Sciel
line: You seem to know me.

speaker: Esquie
line: Yes.

speaker: Sciel
line: How–? I don’t understand–

speaker: Esquie
line: “Men trip not on mountains, they stumble upon stones.”

speaker: Sciel
line: Okay…

speaker: Lune
line: There’s nothing here.

speaker: François
line: Who dares enter my lair?? You can’t just walk into someone’s home without knocking. This is incredibly rude.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is that– Are you François? He’s just a talking rock!

speaker: Gustave
line: Wait, I thought Florrie was a rock.

speaker: François
line: A ROCK! I am NOT a rock, do you have rocks for eyes? You certainly have rocks for BRAINS. I am clearly a TURTLE! ESQUIE! Stop sending hooligans over here.

speaker: Esquie
line: Stop being a meanie. They’re nice Mélanie.

speaker: François
line: Then keep them on your side of the caves! Now get off my lawn!

speaker: Lune
line: It’s okay, we’ll leave, we’re just here for Florrie.

speaker: François
line: So not only are you intruding, you’re here to STEAL? Oh my word. HUMANS! Well! OVER MY DEAD BODY RAAAAHHHH!

speaker: François
line: Ok, let’s us put an end to this foolishness. I need to sleep. Like a turtle.

speaker: Maelle
line: All this trouble for a tiny rock.

speaker: François
line: Take it, and never come back!

speaker: Esquie
line: Hahahaha, ahh, François, you got smashed!

speaker: François
line: But know I will never stop chasing you.

speaker: Maelle
line: But you can’t move…

speaker: François
line: SCRAM!! Hmph, you can give him back his stinking stone, I don’t care. Now, SCRAM!

speaker: Lune
line: François and Esquie are very different from Gestrals and Nevrons.

speaker: Gustave
line: You think the Paintress created them too?

speaker: Lune
line: If not, who else?

speaker: Sciel
line: Maybe they came from another world?

speaker: Esquie
line: You got Florrie! That’s not Florrie.

speaker: Lune
line: What do you mean, “that’s not Florrie?”

speaker: François
line: Ha! I never HAD Florrie! Your rock is still on the Stone Wave Cliffs!

speaker: Esquie
line: Eeeeh, bah, he got me good.

speaker: Gustave
line: Wait, does this mean you won’t help us?

speaker: Esquie
line: If you promise to get me Florrie, then you could be buddies.

speaker: Lune
line: Can’t you swim without–Florrie? We saw you flying just now?

speaker: Esquie
line: You’re much too heavy. I need my rocks!

speaker: Lune
line: Your rocks?

speaker: Esquie
line: Alas! I’ve lost them all. I can do MUCH MORE than swim. I can FLY! Into SPAAAAACE! I used to fly all the time with my best friend Verso!

speaker: Lune
line: We’ll help you find your stones.

speaker: Esquie
line: Oh, how lovely of you.

speaker: Gustave
line: Wait. François said the Stone Wave Cliffs. Where’s that?

speaker: Esquie
line: Allllllllll the way to the north! Just aim for the big “33.” I’ll meet you outside.

speaker: Maelle
line: I see why you like throwing rocks.

speaker: Gustave
line: You’ve been quiet since you saw those people.

speaker: Maelle
line: It felt like they knew me. Like they actually knew me. I don’t understand what’s happening. And, and I feel like I– I never understood. Like I’m always missing something that everyone else just gets. In Lumière, life never made sense and I never fit, and now out here, when it was just starting to maybe feel good, then this… this happens, and…

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, I hate it too. Things we don’t understand. They just make us feel small and powerless. But it helps, you know, to focus on the things I do understand. The people I care about and who care about me. And, uh, you know now I feel a little less lost, ‘cause at least, we’re lost together.

speaker: Maelle
line: (laughs)

speaker: Gustave
line: What? Stop it. Too cheesy? Naah. Well, if it makes you feel better, I was even more lost when I was 16.

speaker: Maelle
line: I heard that was because you were only thinking about girls.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah, but guess what, the girls weren’t thinking about me. At all.

speaker: Maelle
line: I believe that.

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah. You can talk to me, you know. We’re family. Or that’s what the paperwork says, at least.

speaker: Maelle
line: Well, the paperwork probably says we’re dead, too, so…

speaker: Gustave
line: Yeah. Probably. Ooh, nice one.

speaker: Maelle
line: I know.

speaker: Gustave
line: I told you, don’t get cocky, it was… okay.

speaker: Maelle
line: You taught me great. Nah.

speaker: Masked woman
line: I envy them, those who can’t see. Those who know not, that they are not. And those who live, blithe and free, sins forgotten and thus absolved. A fresh dawn in their playground, while we live in shadows, swimming in ink. We are but a fragile dream, a singular weed, resisting, ever resisting. That iron dirt, that eternal law. Those who can’t see. Those who know not, that they are not. Do you know? We are fellows. Those who know not, that they are not.

speaker: Sciel
line: Wanna go for a ride? Apparently that was where people went on dates, you know. What do you think happened in those cabins?

speaker: Gustave
line: No, actually, my guess is this was Expedition 50. You see, they created this giant wheel and they tried to cross the world.

speaker: Sciel
line: Okay, okay, professor.

speaker: Esquie
line: Mes amis! Florrie is close, I can feel it!

speaker: Maelle
line: Come on, you can fly, can’t you get Florrie yourself?

speaker: Esquie
line: Oh no, too much effort.

speaker: Gustave
line: So, wait. Esquie is that powerful?

speaker: Sciel
line: Apparently so. But also lazy.

speaker: Gustave
line: All right, let’s go.

speaker: Sciel
line: What a weird creature.

speaker: Lune
line: A shrine to the Paintress.

speaker: Gustave
line: The Paintress destroyed our world. And someone built her a shrine?

speaker: Lune
line: The weak-minded turn to whatever they can to explain the unknown.

speaker: Sciel
line: When you’re at the mercy of a power you don’t understand, you might try anything.

speaker: Maelle
line: Easier than expected.

speaker: Gustave
line: Hey don’t jinx us. No need to invite misfortune.

speaker: Lune
line: I don’t see any stones.

speaker: Maelle
line: What’s happening?

speaker: Gustave
line: Misfortune.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is it really dead?

speaker: Gustave
line: Looks like it.

speaker: Sciel
line: Is this it?

speaker: Esquie
line: Ooooh! FLORRIE! All right! Ready to sail like a snail! Just jump, mes amis! It’s not that high!

speaker: Lune
line: We can finally cross the sea.

speaker: Sciel
line: You don’t happen to have some wine stashed away, do you?

speaker: Esquie
line: Wine?

speaker: Gustave
line: Hey, you can do this.

speaker: Sciel
line: I hate water.

speaker: Gustave
line: She doesn’t seem that far now, does she?

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah. Wanna throw one more rock?

speaker: Gustave
line: The others are waiting, but…

speaker: Maelle
line: You might reach her.

speaker: Gustave
line: Okay. Ooh, what about that one?

speaker: Maelle
line: Does it really matter?

speaker: Gustave
line: Well, you know, like I always say, it’s not about the rock, it’s more about the–

speaker: Maelle
line: Gustave…

speaker: Gustave
line: Run.

speaker: Maelle
line: Run… Please, run.

speaker: Gustave
line: Why… Why are you doing this? We’ve done NOTHING to you. We should be on the same side. Let her go.

speaker: Sciel
line: Something’s going on up there.

speaker: Lune
line: Esquie, get us up there!

speaker: Esquie
line: I can’t!

speaker: Lune
line: Fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck!

speaker: Gustave
line: For those who come after, right?

speaker: Maelle
line: No, no, no, no… You promised… GUSTAVE! Nonononono–

speaker: White-haired man
line: You won’t yet understand. But this is a kindness, not a cruelty.

speaker: Unknown woman
line: You let her come?! You know she’s too weak for this, how could you let her take such a risk?

speaker: Unknown man
line: You only care when things are right in front of you. My sweet child, you were supposed to stay home. I told you not to worry. But since you’re here now, just stay put–

speaker: Unknown woman
line: What are you saying? You must go home, NOW. This does not involve you.

speaker: Unknown man
line: When this is over, we’ll go home together.

speaker: Unknown woman
line: No!

speaker: White-haired man
line: This won’t make sense to you now, but we both want what’s best for our families. I’m sorry you’re caught in the middle. But I did try to warn you. It’s been a while. Stay out of this. You chose to walk away. You don’t get to come back now and interfere.

speaker: Stranger
line: You’ve lived more than a lifetime. It’s time to let her go.

speaker: White-haired man
line: A lifetime. A lifetime with my family torn apart. No, I want my family back.

speaker: Stranger
line: It’s not your family. But she is.

speaker: White-haired man
line: You would use her?

speaker: Stranger
line: She chose to come. I didn’t make the rules between you two. Hey, are you alright? It’s okay. I’ll handle things here. Get back to your friends. Go.

speaker: White-haired man
line: So that’s it. You’ve set us down this path, but are you ready for the consequences?

speaker: Stranger
line: She’ll never paint again.

speaker: Sciel
line: Last time we sat together like this…

speaker: Lune
line: Mm. In Lumière. Mourning our parents.

speaker: Sciel
line: Seems like everytime we’re together, it’s to grieve. I wish we could have spent more time… in less hopeless contexts.

speaker: Lune
line: The plan doesn’t change. We aim for the Monolith. We keep heading north. With Esquie’s help, we can make it. But we lost the Lumina Converter–

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s ok, we can think about that later–

speaker: Lune
line: All the backups were destroyed by that MAN, but Expedition 32 will bring more, their chances will be better– We need to prepare them. I should update our journals–

speaker: Sciel
line: Hey, hey, hey. It’s ok. Tomorrow will still come.

speaker: Lune
line: Sciel–

speaker: Stranger
line: This seemed important. If you want to reach the Monolith, the best path is through the quarry up north.

speaker: Lune
line: Who are you?

speaker: Sciel
line: And where did you get that expedition uniform?

speaker: Stranger
line: Strange way to say thank you. Um. I’m sorry I couldn’t save your friend. I’m wearing an expedition uniform because I, too, am an Expeditioner–

speaker: Sciel
line: What? What d’you mean, you’re an–

speaker: Lune
line: I’ve never seen you before–

speaker: Stranger
line: First Expedition. Expedition Zero.

speaker: Lune
line: Expedition Zero? But how are you alive? And not–

speaker: Stranger
line: Old? I don’t know, exactly, but some of us stopped aging. And we’re not affected by the Gommage.

speaker: Lune
line: “Some” of you. Like the man on the cliff.

speaker: Stranger
line: Renoir. Our commander.

speaker: Lune
line: Why? Why did he massacre our team?

speaker: Sciel
line: How could he turn on his own people?

speaker: Stranger
line: He believes his immortality is a gift from the Paintress. Killing her would kill him too. And he enjoys living forever.

speaker: Lune
line: And you don’t?

speaker: Stranger
line: Burying everyone you know while you live on… Can wear you down a bit. I couldn’t help your friend, but perhaps, I can help you.

speaker: Lune
line: You want to join us?

speaker: Stranger
line: If you don’t mind the company… Yes.

speaker: Maelle
line: So if I want to kill Renoir, I have to kill the Paintress first. What’s your name?

speaker: Stranger
line: Verso.

speaker: Esquie
line: Mon ami! Oho, you’ve put on a lot of weight.

speaker: Verso
line: I could say the same for you, you giant marshmallow. Bet you lost your stones again?

speaker: Esquie
line: Oho, you know me! But now you’re here! We can go find them.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, buddy, we’ll find them. Tell me… did you tell them about… you know what?

speaker: Esquie
line: Oh, “Maman’s” the word! I promised.

speaker: Verso
line: Great, I’m counting on you.

speaker: Esquie
line: Always, mon ami!

speaker: Verso
line: I’m really sorry I didn’t arrive sooner. He was… your brother?

speaker: Maelle
line: Something like that.

speaker: Verso
line: Losing family is diffic-

speaker: Maelle
line: I know- I know what you’re going to say. You want to offer your condolences. You want to say something comforting. But- I don’t need it. I’ve had enough condolences. I- I’ve lost so many families now, I- I- I just need- Can you please go?

speaker: Verso
line: Head for the Monolith. Through the quarry to the north.

speaker: Sciel
line: Everyone ok?

speaker: Lune
line: This world is full of wonders.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yet everywhere we go, we walk with death.

speaker: Verso
line: You’ll get used to them, we’re going to see a lot more.

speaker: Lune
line: If we hurry, we can cross before nightfall.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait. Could we bury Gustave?

speaker: Lune
line: I wish we could, but protocol is to keep moving. Gustave would understand…

speaker: Sciel
line: We can look for a suitable place. Along the way, yeah? We’ll find a nice spot.

speaker: Verso
line: Actually. There is a place. Past the quarry, out of the sight of the Paintress. A tranquil haven protected by magnificent trees. I think you’ll approve.

speaker: Lune
line: Lead the way.

speaker: Verso
line: Let me show you something.

speaker: Lune
line: Any other tricks we should know?

speaker: Verso
line: One thing at a time.

speaker: Sciel
line: These are all… Expeditions?

speaker: Verso
line: A single Nevron took out most of them.

speaker: Lune
line: Is it still around?

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve only seen him once, many years ago, so most likely not.

speaker: Verso
line: Hey, you holding up? We’re almost there.

speaker: Maelle
line: Holding up? Everywhere we go, just death, death and more death. Everywhere we go, just death. I just- I don’t want to see that anymore.

speaker: Verso
line: Look, Maelle, it-

speaker: Maelle
line: I thought YOU would understand. You said you spent your immortality burying the people around you. Doesn’t any of this bother you? And you. Gustave’s dead. How can you keep going like nothing happened!

speaker: Sciel
line: We need to continue.

speaker: Maelle
line: Why do you-

speaker: Sciel
line: Maelle. You know what we must do. “When one falls…” Come on.

speaker: Sciel
line: Merde!

speaker: Lune
line: Are you hurt?

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m fine- (groan of pain) Thanks.

speaker: Verso
line: Ready?

speaker: Verso
line: Well, turns out this Nevron wasn’t that strong, but you did well. You learn fast.

speaker: Lune
line: All this. This is what we’re fighting for.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is this the place?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. We can bury your friend under this tree, if that’s okay with you.

speaker: Maelle
line: Couldn’t wait for me, could you? I wish we could-

speaker: Lune
line: Rest easy, Gustave.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’ll finish what you started. The Paintress. Renoir. They will pay.

speaker: Sciel
line: No more Dome, just open skies.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’ll save them, Gustave. Emma, your apprentices, everyone.

speaker: Lune
line: You can leave it to us.

speaker: Sciel
line: You were always there for me.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’ll save them.

speaker: Sciel
line: Say hi to Soph for me, yeah?

speaker: Maelle
line: We could never tell if you were my brother or my father. But to me, you were both. The best brother and father I’ve ever had.

speaker: Lune
line: “When one falls, we continue.”

speaker: Maelle
line: Thanks for being my family. See you… in the next life.

speaker: Verso
line: … for about two hours then there’s a big lake. We shouldn’t go there. At all. Like it’s- We should make a right and then it’s going to take a few hours, and then we make a stop, we get some rest and some food, and then from there, we head north to Monoco’s Station.

speaker: Lune
line: Why there?

speaker: Verso
line: To recruit my oldest friend. We’ll need the extra firepower, because our next goal will be to take down the Paintress’ heart.

speaker: Sciel
line: Her heart?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes. You can’t just stroll up to the Paintress. The Chroma there is far too dense, it erases anyone who gets close. But if we destroy her heart, the barrier will fall.

speaker: Lune
line: Ok. So where is this heart? What does it look like?

speaker: Verso
line: What does it look like? That, I don’t know. But I do know that it’s somewhere in the centre of Old Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: You found Old Lumière?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes.

speaker: Lune
line: So it’s true. Before the Fracture, our Lumière was part of a larger city on the continent.

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve travelled with many Expeditions. I was with the 58s when we found Old Lumière. But Renoir erased them, before we could get further. And I don’t know much more.

speaker: Lune
line: Alright then. Let’s go meet your friend at Monoco’s Station. And then we’ll take the Paintress’ heart.

speaker: Sciel
line: How far up the mountain is Monoco’s Station? Will we see snow?

speaker: Verso
line: Not too high but yeah, there’s usually snow.

speaker: Sciel
line: Ah, fantastic!

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, right, there’s no snow in Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: No, only in books and paintings; it’s almost as mythical as gestrals!

speaker: Verso
line: And just as fun. And sometimes just as deadly.

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh, really? My husband was obsessed with the idea of snow. I can’t wait to see some.

speaker: Lune
line: Your older friend is a gestral?

speaker: Verso
line: Yes, we’ve been friends for as long as I can remember.

speaker: Lune
line: Gustave would have loved that.

speaker: Verso
line: Why? Because he liked Gestrals?

speaker: Lune
line: Because… he liked the idea of friendships that could last decades. We don’t get to enjoy such long friendships in Lumière.

speaker: Maelle
line: How come Monoco lives so far from the other gestrals?

speaker: Verso
