line: Monoco’s a “Searcher.” They travel the land looking for Gestrals who went missing after the Fracture.

speaker: Maelle
line: The Lost Gestrals.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. That, and he pissed off Golgra.

speaker: Sciel
line: What’re you working on?

speaker: Lune
line: Contingency plans. If we fail, Expedition 32 will need every bit of information we have.

speaker: Sciel
line: Right, but how’re you gonna get it to them?

speaker: Lune
line: I asked the Gestrals for help.

speaker: Sciel
line: Smart.

speaker: Lune
line: What are the stars whispering to you?

speaker: Sciel
line: Actually, I’m the one whispering to them.

speaker: Lune
line: Oh?

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s something my dad and I used to do. When I was scared or anxious, or even when I was happy. He’d say… “share it with the stars… When it’s hard to talk about things… The stars’ll understand.”

speaker: Lune
line: I like that.

speaker: Sciel
line: I talked to the stars a lot, after he was gone.

speaker: Lune
line: I remember. The night we first met. At the Crooked Tower.

speaker: Sciel
line: Right. After the Gommage.

speaker: Lune
line: I was surprised to find you here. I thought I was the only one who knew about that room.

speaker: Sciel
line: I had to go away from the harbour. And those damn petals everywhere. So I climbed up.

speaker: Lune
line: It wasn’t logical, but part of me really believed my parents and their expedition had succeeded. That they’d stopped Her. Then the Paintress woke. And I knew they weren’t coming home.

speaker: Sciel
line: You know, it meant a lot to me, the comfort we shared that day. But you avoided me after. Why?

speaker: Lune
line: I- It wasn’t personal. I- I cut a lot of people out of my life.

speaker: Sciel
line: Ok. Not personal.

speaker: Lune
line: That day, I knew my parents had failed. They were counting on me to finish their work. I couldn’t afford distractions.

speaker: Sciel
line: Friends are not distractions.

speaker: Lune
line: I know that now.

speaker: Sciel
line: Well. We’re in the middle of nowhere with one year left to live. What better time to build friendships?

speaker: Lune
line: Mm, I could use some wine though.

speaker: Sciel
line: Making friends is thirsty work.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hey…

speaker: Lune
line: Hey…

speaker: Maelle
line: Um… I, um… I didn’t mean…

speaker: Lune
line: It’s fine.

speaker: Maelle
line: I just…

speaker: Lune
line: I miss him too.

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s… it’s hard.

speaker: Lune
line: … The pain we feel… everytime we lose someone… I’ve tried many ways of dealing with it. Running from it. Sitting with it. Compartmentalising it. But what I needed… was to use it. To use everything.

speaker: Maelle
line: What do you mean?

speaker: Lune
line: I- Mm.

speaker: Lune
line: (exhale) I feel… everything… And I let it burn inside me. When I’m tired, when I feel hopeless, when I want to just let it all go… I use the pain, I use the fear, the shame, the guilt, the anger, I use it all to keep going. To make sure. I. Continue.

speaker: Maelle
line: Lune…

speaker: Lune
line: I can almost feel them beside me. Everyone we’ve lost… walking with me. Especially when I use chroma. I feel their presence, their closeness. And they help me.

speaker: Maelle
line: You feel Gustave?

speaker: Lune
line: Yeah, I do.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’d like to feel him with me too…

speaker: Lune
line: You have an affinity for chroma too. Try it.

speaker: Maelle
line: How do you always know what to do…

speaker: Lune
line: I don’t. Want to know a secret? I have no idea what I’m doing. And I don’t think anyone else does either.

speaker: Maelle
line: Huh. Really?

speaker: Lune
line: Don’t tell anyone else I said that.

speaker: Maelle
line: Thanks. It really was a beautiful place.

speaker: Verso
line: Glad you liked it. I’ve buried friends there too. You were right. About condolences. We offer them, because we don’t know what else to say. But there’s no comfort there.

speaker: Maelle
line: No.

speaker: Verso
line: All we can do is carry them with us.

speaker: Maelle
line: I guess. Sorry. It’s just- We’re…

speaker: Verso
line: Drowning in our own sadness? Hey. Why did you join the Expedition? I mean, with the Gommage- I understand the rest of the team’s decision, but you’re half their age.

speaker: Maelle
line: Out here seemed better than in there. At the time.

speaker: Verso
line: It’s natural, wanting to escape a life you don’t want.

speaker: Maelle
line: Escape. yeah. That’s what I wanted. But Gustave and the others… They really want to change things.

speaker: Verso
line: Changing your life also counts. Can’t always shoulder the world’s problems, you know? That’ll drain you fast.

speaker: Maelle
line: Gustave would probably say, if more of us cared, then it would lighten the load for everyone.

speaker: Verso
line: He sounds like a good guy.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait. I kept Gustave’s. So you can have mine. You’ll need one if you want to be an official member of our merry crew.

speaker: Verso
line: I gotta say, I didn’t take you for an “official” kind of person.

speaker: Maelle
line: Welcome to the Disaster Expedition.

speaker: Verso
line: Thank you.

speaker: Verso
line: Follow the tracks, they’ll lead us to Monoco.

speaker: Maelle
line: A train. Gustave would have liked to see that.

speaker: Lune
line: Is it true, before the Fracture, Lumière had trains running throughout the continent?

speaker: Verso
line: Always running late, but running, yes.

speaker: Verso
line: If Monoco’s not here, that means– Slow as ever, mon vieux.

speaker: Monoco
line: Your reflexes remain sharp as ever. I approve.

speaker: Esquie
line: MOMO!

speaker: Monoco
line: Esquie! Did Verso pull you into another adventure? Mmm. New friends?

speaker: Lune
line: You speak our language?

speaker: Verso
line: We had a lot of time to kill, so I taught him.

speaker: Monoco
line: Ladies. Could I OW– interest you in a duel?

speaker: Maelle
line: Yep, definitely a Gestral.

speaker: Verso
line: No point trying to talk until we’ve calmed Monoco down with a “relaxing” fight. Be careful though, Monoco’s fighting style is a bit… peculiar.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Woo, woo, woo, woo, woo! NEVRON!! Oh, hi.

speaker: Monoco
line: No distractions, son! I’m really busy beating up strangers.

speaker: Maelle
line: Noco! What’re you doing here?

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Even with Esquie, you’re still so slow! Oh! Where’s the man with the weird arm?

speaker: Verso
line: Uh. Noco, you said Nevron?

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Oh, yeah! A Stalact is approaching! The Grandis are taking cover. Come on, come on!

speaker: Monoco
line: Oh. Hm. A Stalact.

speaker: Monoco
line: Friends of Verso. As “Honoured Guests,” the first fight is yours! Defeat the Stalact with your fearsome talents!

speaker: Sciel
line: Right. Oh. You’re serious.

speaker: Verso
line: Yes, he is. You little coward.

speaker: Monoco
line: You’ve found worthy friends, Verso.

speaker: Verso
line: Jealous?

speaker: Sciel
line: What are you doing?

speaker: Monoco
line: I just need… the foot. Ahah!

speaker: Verso
line: He transforms by collecting Nevron feet. Don’t ask me how it works, I’ve never understood.

speaker: Monoco
line: Now that we’ve had some good battles to warm the spirits, to what do we owe the pleasure of your company?

speaker: Verso
line: We are heading for Old Lumière.

speaker: Monoco
line: Ok, bye.

speaker: Verso
line: Hey, come on. Hey! Hey, look, I know we failed before, but– Look, you doofus, don’t you recognize her?

speaker: Monoco
line: Of course, I do–

speaker: Verso
line: Then you know what that means. This our shot, it might be our only shot.

speaker: Monoco
line: This is YOUR only shot. Out of question. I will never join you again.

speaker: Verso
line: There will be a lot of fighting though.

speaker: Monoco
line: Oh yeah, that’s true.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, that’s true.

speaker: Monoco
line: There will be a lot of fighting.

speaker: Verso
line: Exactly.

speaker: Monoco
line: Count me in then.

speaker: Verso
line: Good.

speaker: Monoco
line: Good.

speaker: Verso
line: Good.

speaker: Monoco
line: Good.

speaker: Verso
line: Yes, good.

speaker: Maelle
line: Noco’s coming too.

speaker: Verso
line: You are???

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Not a lot of merchants go to Old Lumière! There will be tons of rare shiny treasure and then I shall be– THE UNDISPUTED. TOP. MERCHANT. IN THE WORLD!

speaker: Monoco
line: As a responsible parent, this is a superb idea. Let us go. To Old Lumière.

speaker: Monoco
line: Welcome, my friends, to Old Lumière.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is anyone still here?

speaker: Verso
line: Just Nevrons.

speaker: Sciel
line: So this is where our piece of Lumière used to be. Before the Fracture ripped apart the world and threw us into the sea.

speaker: Lune
line: We’re lucky it did, that’s probably the only reason we survived.

speaker: Verso
line: The heart of the Paintress is in the centre, let’s go.

speaker: Lune
line: Hm. We’ll need a way forward.

speaker: Verso
line: The heart is in the centre of the city. Alright, show off a bit, Monoco.

speaker: Monoco
line: Just admit you can’t do it yourself.

speaker: Verso
line: Putain! MONOCO!

speaker: Lune
line: Monoco, why the hell did you-

speaker: Monoco
line: Sorry. I fucked up. I just wanted to show off.

speaker: Sciel
line: We just have to regroup, the others should be fine. Verso said the heart is in the centre of Old Lumière, right?

speaker: Lune
line: Right. Okay. Monoco, stop crying, we have to move.

speaker: Monoco
line: Yes. Sorry.

speaker: Sciel
line: How exactly did our piece of Lumière end up on an island, when the rest of the city is here?

speaker: Monoco
line: One of the great mysteries.

speaker: Lune
line: I wish we had more time, there’s so much to study here.

speaker: Sciel
line: So, Monoco, what was life like before the Fracture?

speaker: Monoco
line: The world was smaller and cosier. Livelier. There was many more of us Gestrals back then. The Fracture tore our villages apart. Only a fraction of a fraction survived. Our forests are filled with Gestrals awaiting rebirth.

speaker: Sciel
line: Doesn’t that look like one of Esquie’s stones?

speaker: Lune
line: Oh, yeah.

speaker: Sciel
line: Let’s bring him a gift. I was surprised you agreed so readily to Verso’s plans.

speaker: Lune
line: He seems to be our best bet for now. We lack too much information.

speaker: Sciel
line: Do you trust him?

speaker: Lune
line: I trust that he wants to reach the Paintress. So for now, our interests are aligned.

speaker: Sciel
line: He has been helpful. Still, I have this feeling he’s hiding something.

speaker: Lune
line: Monoco, how did you meet Verso?

speaker: Monoco
line: Hm. I don’t really remember. I feel like I’ve always known Verso.

speaker: Lune
line: He mentioned travelling with other Expeditions.

speaker: Monoco
line: Quite a few.

speaker: Lune
line: How many? What happened to them?

speaker: Monoco
line: Hmmm… Hmmm… What happened to them…

speaker: Sciel
line: Maybe ask Verso when we find him.

speaker: Lune
line: Yeah, okay. Finding them comes first. Any idea what this is?

speaker: Monoco
line: I’m afraid not. This is my first time here as well.

speaker: Sciel
line: 58. They were the ones that Verso was travelling with?

speaker: Lune
line: I believe so. They made it surprisingly far. An Axon. Interesting. Verso is… Is this true?

speaker: Sciel
line: Maelle’s with him.

speaker: Lune
line: We need to go. NOW.

speaker: Monoco
line: Verso would never harm her.

speaker: Verso
line: Can you stand? Monoco gets a bit carried away sometimes.

speaker: Maelle
line: My back hurts, but I’m fine.

speaker: Verso
line: Good. The others are probably heading toward the centre of the city. We’ll rejoin them there.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) And find treasure along the way!

speaker: Maelle
line: Feels like home.

speaker: Verso
line: yeah, feels like home. You ok?

speaker: Maelle
line: Monoco fits well in the Disaster Expedition, eh?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, he does. After you.

speaker: Maelle
line: Speaking of home, where’d you live in Lumière?

speaker: Verso
line: Above a bakery near the centre. Um… Angelique’s Boulangerie! I ate there every morning. I wonder if it’s still there.

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s called “Mathilde”s” now. When this is over, you should go and visit.

speaker: Maelle
line: We’re a pretty good team. Verso? VERSO? Putain. What- Where did he go? Verso, where did you go… I need to find Lune and Sciel. Quickly.

speaker: Noco
line: (gibberish) Hihihi. I’m still here! Don’t worry, Verso runs off all the time. He’s always ditching me and Monoco. He’ll be back.

speaker: Verso
line: I knew you’d open the door for her. Merde.

speaker: Renoir
line: Really, Verso? This was your plan? How many times must you hurt our family.

speaker: Verso
line: No. No, you don’t get to lecture ME on family.

speaker: Renoir
line: Why do you refuse to see I am doing this for us? Yet you insist on rushing toward death. You’re trying to stop the wrong cycle.

speaker: Verso
line: You’re doing this for yourself.

speaker: Renoir
line: Of course, it’s easier for you to think that, isn’t it? Easier to betray us, if I’m the villain.

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso, move. I’m gonna fucking kill him.

speaker: Renoir
line: You haven’t told her the truth, have you, son?

speaker: Lune
line: Sorry, we’re late, we were busy doing a bit of reading. Were you planning on sharing that this man, the man who murdered our team, is your father?

speaker: Verso
line: Family is not my favourite topic. right, can we talk about this later? I’d really like for you all to survive this.

speaker: Verso
line: Everyone all right? Monoco?

speaker: Monoco
line: Noco’s- broken.

speaker: Renoir
line: Why can’t you accept who you are?

speaker: Verso
line: ALICIA, MOVE!

speaker: Maelle
line: What is tha- Will you… Tell me your name?

speaker: Verso
line: Putain! Where did it go? No, no, no, no. Alicia! Fuck! (angry roar)

speaker: Esquie
line: Oooooh Dorrie! Thank you, mon amie!

speaker: Lune
line: Care to explain? Your father?

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t think of him as my father anymore.

speaker: Sciel
line: Still. Why didn’t you just tell us?

speaker: Verso
line: Because it’s private and it’s painful. And it’s none of your business. I cut ties with him decades ago.

speaker: Lune
line: Lying by omission is still lying.

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve told you everything you need to know-

speaker: Lune
line: I’d rather make that determination for myself.

speaker: Sciel
line: I think we can all understand where each other’s wyoming from. Right? He hasn’t steered us wrong yet. But we’re a team now. And we won’t get very far if we don’t trust each other.

speaker: Maelle
line: Family- is complicated.

speaker: Lune
line: The stories say that Gestrals reincarnate? Is that true? Can you bring Noco back?

speaker: Monoco
line: Partially. We can bring Noco back to life, but not all of Noco will return. It will be- a different Noco. The one you knew is gone.

speaker: Verso
line: I’m- I am so very sorry, my friend. And all… all for naught. The Paintress’ heart was in that manor and now it’s gone. We have no way to access the Monolith.

speaker: Lune
line: Expedition 58 seemed to think you knew another way.

speaker: Verso
line: What?

speaker: Lune
line: We found 58 and their journals.

speaker: Verso
line: So that’s how you- I wasn’t hiding it, if that’s what you’re implying. It’s a dead end.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait, what’re you talking about?

speaker: Lune
line: There is someone else who can help us.

speaker: Lune
line: Excuse me. Is it true? Can you make a weapon that can pierce the barrier? Do you need something from the Axons?

speaker: The Curator
line: (gibberish) Axons. Axons.

speaker: Lune
line: Do you need… their hearts?

speaker: Verso
line: Look. To create this weapon, he needs enormous amounts of pure chroma. Which is way beyond what we can get from Nevrons. The only source are Axons, but like I said, that’s a dead end, it’s impossible.

speaker: Maelle
line: What? What are Axons?

speaker: Verso
line: They’re massive creatures living on islands around the Monolith. They’re much stronger and MUCH, MUCH more dangerous than Nevrons. I can’t die and I still couldn’t take them down.

speaker: Lune
line: Yet we found the corpse of one in Old Lumière. So it’s possible.

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t know how that one die, but I’m telling you, listen to me, please, our chances of taking them down without you lot dying are close to zero.

speaker: Lune
line: Close, but not zero. Death is coming either way. And as Expeditioners, if we die, we die fighting.

speaker: Monoco
line: Wonderful pep talk.

speaker: Lune
line: I know.

speaker: Verso
line: Alright, if – IF – we’re going to fight the Axons, then let’s be smart about it.

speaker: Sciel
line: What d’you mean?

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve had a few rough encounters with the Axons. There are three located on islands around the Monolith. and we need at least two hearts to get enough chroma. One lives on a mountain, too high for us to reach, so that one’s out. We should start with the one to the west of the Monolith. It’s already been weakened by previous Expeditions, alright?

speaker: Lune
line: Yeah, good idea. Maximise our chances.

speaker: Sciel
line: Or we embrace the challenge and pick the one in the east!

speaker: Monoco
line: Mmmmm, I like your spirit.

speaker: Sciel
line: Thank you.

speaker: Verso
line: Did you listen to what I just said?

speaker: Verso
line: Lune…

speaker: Lune
line: Mm.

speaker: Verso
line: Okay, we’ll talk later then.

speaker: Esquie
line: I’m mad.

speaker: Verso
line: Esquie?

speaker: Esquie
line: I’m stinking mad.

speaker: Verso
line: About Noco?

speaker: Esquie
line: That was MEAN. I thought he cared! Renoir’s not being Renoir!

speaker: Verso
line: He’s not- (exhale) I know, buddy. I’m mad too.

speaker: Maelle
line: So the masked person with Renoir, that’s your sister?

speaker: Maelle
line: Not a hard leap to make.

speaker: Verso
line: Her name’s Alicia.

speaker: Maelle
line: What’s wrong with her? She wears a mask all the time, she never talks, and she’s always staring.

speaker: Verso
line: She, uh- She was trapped in a fire. A long time ago. Damaged her face and her throat, so, up- Yeah.

speaker: Maelle
line: Huh. Why… did they come to see me?

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t know. That surprised me, when you told me. She helped me before, I thought she’d help me again. But it seems she’s chosen a different side. “Family is complicated,” right?

speaker: Maelle
line: Mm. Yeah.

speaker: Verso
line: Do you want the armband back?

speaker: Maelle
line: What?

speaker: Verso
line: I feel like a fraud, wearing it. Given, you know…

speaker: Maelle
line: Wear it anyway. You said you chose your side, right?

speaker: Verso
line: I did. You’re not upset with me?

speaker: Maelle
line: Strangely, no. I hate secrets, but… Gustave always gave people the benefit of the doubt. And your actions are what matters. I trust you.

speaker: Verso
line: Thanks.

speaker: Lune
line: So this is Visages’ island…

speaker: Monoco
line: He Who Guards Truth With Lies.

speaker: Sciel
line: Are those… Faces?

speaker: Monoco
line: An infinite sea of them.

speaker: Sciel
line: Is this island… singing?

speaker: Maelle
line: This melody…

speaker: Lune
line: This is creeping me out.

speaker: Sciel
line: What’s it doing?

speaker: Verso
line: It’s not attacking…

speaker: Maelle
line: Was that an invitation?

speaker: Sciel
line: So it seems?

speaker: Verso
line: Mm-mm. Feels like a trap.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t mind a straightforward path for once. Better than battling through a mountain of Nevrons.

speaker: Sciel
line: No, Verso’s right. Something feels off.

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: Oh, I’m harmless, you don’t need those.

speaker: Verso
line: Well, if you’re harmless, then these weapons will stay harmless too.

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: Touché. Well. Visages invites you to join him in his chamber at the end of this path. I assume that’s why you’re here?

speaker: Sciel
line: Where do the other paths lead?

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: You’re free to traverse them. Masks are not just to obscure. They may also illuminate. Look for the masks that you need.

speaker: Maelle
line: Meaning?

speaker: Mark Keeper
line: The invitation stands.

speaker: Sciel
line: Well. Head straight to the Axon or take the other paths?

speaker: Maelle
line: Did you hear that?

speaker: Verso
line: That was the Axon.

speaker: Sciel
line: Destroying these masks seems to hurt him.

speaker: Lune
line: Then let’s keep doing that.

speaker: Sciel
line: I know they’re Nevrons, but… witnessing the sorrow of others… I can’t help but feel for them.

speaker: Monoco
line: A noble but tremendously fatal impulse.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yeah, it definitely hurts him. I think I saw one more path.

speaker: Verso
line: That’s good, we’re weakening him.

speaker: Sciel
line: This feels… off…

speaker: Lune
line: Everything’s destroyed.

speaker: Monoco
line: Normally I enjoy a little destruction, but this doesn’t feel right.

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s rage.

speaker: Lune
line: Monoco, what does that mean, “He Who Guards Truth With Lies?”

speaker: Monoco
line: Exactly what it sounds like.

speaker: Sciel
line: Guard as in protect? Or guard as in control?

speaker: Monoco
line: Yes.

speaker: Verso
line: I think you pissed him off.

speaker: Mask Keeper
line: People want so badly to know, “What’s behind the mask?” Front, back. Recto, verso. Great art is both window and mirror. Whether it’s your mask or theirs.

speaker: Verso
line: Harmless, huh.

speaker: Sciel
line: He’s the real Axon.

speaker: Mask Keeper
line: Child, we all need masks, but how you use them, mmm.

speaker: Maelle
line: Merde.

speaker: Maelle
line: We did it!

speaker: Sciel
line: No, wait-

speaker: Mask Keeper
line: We all need masks-

speaker: Sciel
line: This mask can’t hurt me. Because it is me.

speaker: Verso
line: You okay? What happened?

speaker: Sciel
line: Axon down. Let’s bring this to the Curator.

speaker: Verso
line: That was Verso, wasn’t it? Renoir?

speaker: Maelle
line: Me? You want me to give it to you?

speaker: Lune
line: Why?

speaker: Maelle
line: That was- I saw-

speaker: Sciel
line: What happened?

speaker: Maelle
line: I saw- I saw… It was… Renoir?

speaker: Verso
line: I used to see him in my nightmares too. He can be quite traumatising.

speaker: Lune
line: The architecture looks very different here.

speaker: Monoco
line: This kind of place never existed before the Fracture.

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s beautiful… Feels surreal…

speaker: Lune
line: Is she the Axon?

speaker: Monoco
line: Sirène. She Who Plays With Wonder.

speaker: Verso
line: Putain.

speaker: Maelle
line: Lune? What’s going on?

speaker: Lune
line: I-I don’t know-

speaker: Monoco
line: She’s manipulating your emotions! You have to focus. Remember why you’re here. Be careful. They call her She Who Plays with Wonder. But what she really does is play with your head.

speaker: Verso
line: Let’s move fast, before we all lose our minds.

speaker: Verso
line: Don’t look at her for too long or you’ll go insane. I’ve seen people jumping off a cliff just from looking at her…

speaker: Lune
line: It is… Mesmerising.

speaker: Maelle
line: This dance feels familiar. Was this kind of dancing taught in Lumière?

speaker: Sciel
line: I don’t think so, never seen it.

speaker: Maelle
line: This place is huge.

speaker: Verso
line: Thank Expedition 67 for destroying a lot of walls to get further. Couldn’t progress without that.

speaker: Lune
line: It feels like home.

speaker: Maelle
line: What’s THAT?

speaker: Verso
line: The tisseur, it works for Sirène.

speaker: Lune
line: So he creates all of that for her.

speaker: Verso
line: We should take it out. It would definitely be an advantage against Sirène.

speaker: Verso
line: Good job, no other expedition managed that.

speaker: Maelle
line: No other expedition had a Lumina converter.

speaker: Lune
line: Yet this victory feels hollow…

speaker: Monoco
line: We’re finally there.

speaker: Verso
line: She’s waiting at the end of this tunnel.

speaker: Lune
line: Then we should prepare before we head there. She’s even grander than I thought.

speaker: Verso
line: Lune, you’re ok, right?

speaker: Maelle
line: I swear I’ve seen this dance before.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is it… You again? Who are-

speaker: Verso
line: Maelle?

speaker: Lune
line: What did you see this time?

speaker: Maelle
line: I-I don’t know. A- A woman. It was- Why do I keep seeing things? Who are you?

speaker: Sciel
line: We’ve done it.

speaker: Maelle
line: We’re really going to face the Paintress.

speaker: Lune
line: And finally break this cycle.

speaker: Sciel
line: That being said… Someone here has been hiding a terrible secret from us.

speaker: Lune
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: Sciel
line: You thought we’d never find out, didn’t you? Nobody ever wondered what Esquie was made of, did they? Well, Esquie and I had a chat.

speaker: Esquie
line: I’m sorry, Verso! She promised me sweet rocks!

speaker: Lune
line: What! Is that wine?

speaker: Verso
line: I stored my personal stash inside him. All excellent vintages. I don’t normally share, but I suppose tonight deserves an exception.

speaker: Esquie
line: Mon ami, I told you to stop drinking alone.

speaker: Sciel
line: To your great generosity.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t know how you can like this.

speaker: Lune
line: It comes with age.

speaker: Maelle
line: Do you have apple juice?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, I’ll, uh, I’ll leave you to it.

speaker: Verso
line: My beautiful sister doesn’t need this ugly mask.

speaker: Renoir
line: You embrace her, yet you’re condemning her to die.

speaker: Verso
line: You brought him here?!

speaker: Renoir
line: I’m not here to fight. But my son, do you know what it means to disappear into nothingness? Have you thought through the consequences? Not just for you, or even me, but for them. Their memories, their dreams, their love for each other? Who really is the one painting death? And who paints life instead? We exist and we will exist for as long as she wants. You want to spoil what we’ve been given. Sometimes, we paint the bars of our own prison. Your despair blinds you. You think you’re ready to pay the price. But are you willing to let THEM pay the price for YOU?

speaker: Renoir/Verso
line: May everything be decided before their very eyes. Between the bars of their prison.

speaker: Verso
line: In the shadow of the Monolith.

speaker: Renoir
line: In the shadow of the Monolith.

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle, you should do the honours.

speaker: Maelle
line: (screams)

speaker: Maelle
line: We can– We can do this. For Gustave.

speaker: Lune
line: For all of them.

speaker: Lune
line: Our attacks do nothing!

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t understand, the Gradient Attacks should work– Wait, Maelle.

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t think this is the–

speaker: Verso
line: No, nononono.

speaker: Lune
line: Everybody okay?

speaker: Verso
line: Follow her. Quickly.

speaker: Lune
line: What?

speaker: Verso
line: This might be our only chance.

speaker: Lune
line: Yeah. Ok.

speaker: Lune
line: We are… inside the Monolith… What was that thing? Why did it help us inside?

speaker: Sciel
line: Are you alright, Maelle?

speaker: Maelle
line: Up– Up there– She’s– The Paintress– She’s up there.

speaker: Verso
line: What do you mean?

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t know, but I can sense– The real Paintress– Her heart is above us somewhere.

speaker: Lune
line: I guess we head up then.

speaker: Lune
line: Verso, what was that?

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t know…

speaker: Maelle
line: Fire. Again.

speaker: Lune
line: Again…

speaker: Lune
line: Teaching her children to paint, huh…

speaker: Lune
line: Who is she fighting?

speaker: Sciel
line: Her husband?

speaker: Maelle
line: We’re inside her mind… These are memories…

speaker: Lune
line: How do you know that?

speaker: Maelle
line: The Chroma here… I can “read” it.

speaker: Lune
line: I don’t understand…

speaker: Sciel
line: Verso, you ok?

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah, fine. Let’s keep moving, we’re almost at the top.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is that- You…

speaker: Verso
line: We’re taking her down.

speaker: Renoir
line: She’s not the only one who grieves. The pain of losing you… She made me inherit it. Punishment, perhaps, for not being there when it mattered. I refuse to lose my son.

speaker: Verso
line: That son was a stranger.

speaker: Renoir
line: But you’re not. You’re not.

speaker: Verso
line: You lost me years ago. And I lost you.

speaker: Renoir
line: So you leave us no choice? How are you different from her in doing this?

speaker: Verso
line: I’m tired.

speaker: Renoir
line: So trust me. We are your family.

speaker: Verso
line: Family is… complicated.

speaker: Renoir
line: If saving you means losing you, then so be it.

speaker: Verso
line: We only need to incapacitate him.

speaker: Maelle
line: We’ll find a way to kill him.

speaker: Renoir
line: Remember who your REAL family is. It’s not her. It’s your sister. Your mother. Me. WE are your family. You would condemn us all to die, for what? Who do you really save with your sacrifice?

speaker: Maelle
line: Your sister. And… your mother…

speaker: Verso
line: You’re too drunk on your own illusion to understand.

speaker: Renoir
line: Then let us celebrate the second destruction of the Dessendre family. At long last, we meet. This is all you have left of your son. Destroying it won’t bring your wife back. It will only destroy the last tie you have to each other. I love them too.

speaker: Maelle
line: We did it, Gustave–

speaker: Lune
line: Hey. How did you do that?

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m not sure. The Curator– I felt it–

speaker: Lune
line: Can you do it again?

speaker: Maelle
line: I don’t know– uh. I think so? Yeah, yeah I think I can.

speaker: Sciel
line: What did Renoir mean? The things he said to the Curator.

speaker: Verso
line: I’m– I’m not sure.

speaker: Maelle
line: She’s through there.

speaker: Lune
line: Yeah. Behind this door is the future of Lumière. What every expedition has worked towards. I have trust… in us.

speaker: Lune
line: We’re… outside?

speaker: Maelle
line: She’s there– I can feel her.

speaker: Monoco
line: We need to be as prepared as possible. Once we go up, there’s no turning back.

speaker: Maelle
line: That’s her. The Paintress.

speaker: Sciel
line: She looks like the Curator.

speaker: Lune
line: Renoir. He mentioned the Curator’s wife. She’s the Paintress?

speaker: The Paintress
line: You’ve come– back– But the fire– Are you really here? Or is He–? Oh… is he playing tricks again? Alicia…

speaker: Lune
line: Alicia?

speaker: The Paintress
line: Your face–

speaker: Maelle
line: My face? What about my face? Are you going to burn it again?

speaker: Lune
line: Alicia’s your daughter.

speaker: Sciel
line: And Maelle reminds you of her. The daughter you lost.

speaker: The Paintress
line: Come along. Let’s go home.

speaker: Verso
line: Yes. You need to go home.

speaker: The Paintress
line: This is another trick. She’s not Alicia. You are not my Verso.

speaker: Verso
line: No, Verso’s dead.

speaker: The Paintress
line: No, no, you are HIS creations, not mine. You will not take this Canvas from me!

speaker: Verso
line: This is what we created the Expeditions for.

speaker: Lune
line: Tomorrow comes.

speaker: The Paintress
line: How cruel of your father to use you like this.

speaker: Verso
line: Merde! I don’t like this. Esquie! Look what I found.

speaker: Esquie
line: Oooooh! SOARRIE! Whoooohooo! All aboard!

speaker: Lune
line: Let’s go.

speaker: The Paintress
line: Renoir can grieve however he likes. But I get to grieve my own way.

speaker: The Paintress
line: Why?

speaker: Verso
line: Rest now. Things’ll be better soon.

speaker: The Paintress
line: Alicia.

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s… over. The number–

speaker: Lune
line: She’s gone.

speaker: Monoco
line: It’s done. You’re free. You are all free.

speaker: Maelle
line: Is this real?

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah. And I’m pretty sure Gustave’s watching over us. Hey, come– Wanna plant it?

speaker: Lune
line: Though presumably, there will be no one coming after, right?

speaker: Sciel
line: It’s symbolic!

speaker: Maelle
line: Let’s… let’s go home.

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah.

speaker: Sciel
line: Still feel immortal?

speaker: Verso
line: No less than yesterday.

speaker: Sciel
line: Shall we test it out?

speaker: Verso
line: I appreciate the offer.

speaker: Sciel
line: Monoco. You’ve been extra quiet since we got to the Monolith.

speaker: Monoco
line: Have I?

speaker: Maelle
line: What now? We go back to Lumière and… life goes on?

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah. Decades and decades in front of us. Guess this is how it feels to be immortal. What do we do now with all this time?

speaker: Lune
line: The Expedition might be over… But we’re not done yet. There are so many questions left to answer.

speaker: Esquie
line: LUMIERE… LUMIERE AHEAD! OOOOH!

speaker: Alicia
line: Brother, I tire of the conflicts and deceptions that plague our family and theirs. So I entrust you with this letter. Whether you give it to her is up to you. I’m at peace with what’s to come. When the time comes, I hope you will be too.

speaker: Alicia
line: Maelle. It’s a strange feeling, watching you with my brother. Laughing and smiling. Without the scars or the memories that afflict me. Alicia – as she was meant to be. Not this painted version that I am. My family, a facsimile of yours. And this world, a mirror. Painted by our mother, the Paintress, to stave off her grief.

speaker: Alicia
line: Seeing your expedition through would plunge us all into the abyss. For in ridding the world of the Paintress… You’d lose the sole force standing against the one who would erase us. The one who invokes the flowers of the Gommage. An act of love. For he does love her. Your Father.

speaker: Alicia
line: On her Monolith, she paints a warning for us all. Of the few she can save as her power wanes. We all wish for our families to thrive. Your family, however, believes only one can survive. But perhaps you’ll find another way. You who have lived amongst us. Perhaps you differ from your father and your father, as I differ from mine. Your mother paints life. While your father, death. What will you paint?

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Alicia?

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Good, you’re awake. Come downstairs.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Come along now, I’m in Renoir’s atelier. Alicia, quit dawdling. End of the corridor, you know where it is. Finally. Our little shadow is awake. Our parents are quite the stubborn pair. They’re still fighting each other inside the Canvas. He has her imprisoned at the top of her Monolith and she has him trapped beneath. It’s a stalemate.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: (I’m worried. They’ve been inside the Canvas for so long.)

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: They’ve spent longer than this in other Canvases. It’s not that dire.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Yes, I know. Maman’s been in there for quite a while already. And Renoir is wasting time in there, trying to help someone who doesn’t want his help. We have more urgent matters to attend to.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: (Did you see… Verso?)

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: You’re as bad as Aline. He’s not Verso. He’s a painted copy, built from our mother’s memories. You’d do well to remember that.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: (I know that, I’m not a child.)

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Don’t roll your eyes at me, sister dear. I know you’re not a child, but you’re not grown either. And too many in our family have lost all caution and sense of late.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: (Can you help Maman?)

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Help her do what? Run away and hide? She’s already succeeded there. Honestly, if Aline wants to numb herself in the Canvas, then let her.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Grief is no excuse. We’re all grieving. She’s a grown woman and she was the head of the Painter’s Council. She failed her responsibilities. I don’t have time to coddle her. And before Verso died, she would have said the same.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: (Can you help Papa?)

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: I already have. Aline is more skilled than Renoir, but I’ve tipped the scales in his favour. I have my pets in place. “She who controls chromas, controls the Canvas.” I can’t take her chroma, but I can keep it from returning to her.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Yes, it’s enough. It’s just a matter of time. As she weakens, Renoir is able to erase her oldest creations. With the exception of her obscene fake family. She’s made them immortal, but luckily, they’re also quite useless. I need you to take care of yourself while I’m gone.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: (You’re leaving?)

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Don’t be naive. The world doesn’t stop simply because our family is in mourning. The conflict is spreading and there are things I must do if we Painters are to survive.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: (I… I want to help.)

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: You will do nothing. You’re too weak to do anything useful, you’d be a liability. The Writers used you against us once before, they won’t hesitate to use you again. And I can’t promise that I’ll make the same choice Verso made. Verso traded his life for yours. I both love and hate him for that. The damn fool. Although… If you really want to be useful, then enter the Canvas and help Renoir. I need him back here sooner rather than later. I’ll fight this war alone if I have to, but I’d really rather not. Can you handle that?

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Lest you forget, the only reason those two are in there is because your naivety cost Verso his life.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Good. Go to the Canvas when you’re ready. And repaint your throat when you’re in there, before you completely forget how to have a conversation.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Alicia
line: If we bring Maman out of the Canvas, she’ll try to return. We must hide the Canvas…

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Clea
line: Well-reasoned. And such a… clever hiding spot you’ve chosen. She’ll still find it, but… I’m impressed. This only truly ends if you destroy the Canvas. And that means stopping the final sliver of Verso’s soul from painting. See, that wasn’t so hard. Wait- that’s Aline’s chroma. Stay calm, don’t let it take control of you. Calm, Alicia, or it’ll paint over you- What an auspicious start. Well. You’re about to be reborn in this world as one of Aline’s creations. Have fun. At least this will keep you out of trouble until I get back.

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Man from Lumière
line: Oh, she’s a girl… She’s a girl! She’s beautiful. What… What a lovely voice. My love, did you decide on a name?

chapter: A glimpse in the past – Monolith Year 49
speaker: Woman from Lumière
line: Yes. Oh, my darling girl. We have precious little time together. You’ll never know us… but I want you to know that you are loved. I want you to know… you’re not alone. You will always be the beautiful child I held in my arms. You will smile the brightest smile. You will cry iridescent tears. You will know love and you will know pain. You will know loss all too well. Because we live in an unforgiving world. But you are strong and you will survive. You will struggle… And you will learn. You’ll find people to call your own. And you’ll shine as their guiding light. For you will change the world and the people around you. You’ll forever be our princess. I have decided on her name. And her name will be… Maelle.

speaker: Verso
line: Alicia?

speaker: Maelle
line: Actually, I prefer “Maelle.”

speaker: Verso
line: I think I do too. But I’m not really Verso, and you’re not really Maelle, are you?

speaker: Maelle
line: You’re not Verso, no. You look and sound just like him. But you’re you. I’m still Maelle though. You should’ve helped me remember.

speaker: Verso
line: Yeah. I… I wanted to— but I… I’m sorry.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m sorry too. If I’d listened to Maman— If I hadn’t trusted the Writers, Verso would still be alive, and you—

speaker: Verso
line: Wouldn’t exist.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wouldn’t be caught in the middle. Maman did a terrible thing, painting you into Verso’s Canvas. Giving you his memories. Pretending the fire only took me. But I’m glad you exist.

speaker: Verso
line: Your father was right to erase everyone. It’s better this way.

speaker: Maelle
line: Better for who? Verso would have never wanted his Canvas gone. He loved Esquie and his Gestrals and Grandis.

speaker: Verso
line: It was killing my… our mother, staying here so long in a make-believe world with her make-believe family.

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s not make-believe. It’s not… You’re not… To me. Papa’s here. He’ll help me fix Lumière.

speaker: Verso
line: Will he?

speaker: Maelle
line: Maman painted a rather unflattering portrait of him. He’s much warmer than the Renoir you know.

speaker: Verso
line: I bet.

speaker: Verso
line: Your father was the one erasing everyone. Why would he help repaint everything?

speaker: Maelle
line: I hid the Canvas before I entered, so Maman can’t come back again. There’s no need to erase the Canvas anymore.

speaker: Verso
line: He’ll want you to go home.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m not at risk like Maman. I haven’t been in this Canvas that long. Besides, Papa has a soft spot for me, he’ll listen.

speaker: Verso
line: Hmm.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa!

speaker: Renoir
line: Alicia. You’re safe. I thought I told you to stay home.

speaker: Maelle
line: Technically my body’s at home.

speaker: Renoir
line: Some of Aline’s finest work. I regret that it caused you so much pain. What Aline did was unfair, to you most of all. Please, accept the Dessendre family’s apologies. I know it seems absurd to offer oblivion as recompense, but perhaps that’s the outcome we both desire.

speaker: Maelle
line: What—

speaker: Renoir
line: I’m proud of you. Getting your mother out of the Canvas was not easy. But once we erase the Canvas, we won’t have to worry anymore.

speaker: Maelle
line: But she’s home now, why—

speaker: Renoir
line: You know your mother. Verso painted this Canvas, it contains a piece of his soul. She’ll never willingly part with it.

speaker: Maelle
line: No.

speaker: Renoir
line: For the sake of the living, we must part with the dead.

speaker: Maelle
line: No, Papa, see, I hid the canvas—

speaker: Renoir
line: She will always find it. This is our only opportunity, while she’s too sick from her prolonged descent into the canvas to return.

speaker: Maelle
line: But— No… Papa, Papa, please. This is Verso’s only Canvas. You can’t destroy the last piece of him that we have. This is my home now! You can’t just decide—

speaker: Renoir
line: Your home? After all that with your mother, you want to stay?

speaker: Maelle
line: You know how little remains of my life. Outside.

speaker: Renoir
line: Alicia. You’ll die. You’ve already been here longer than you should.

speaker: Maelle
line: But—

speaker: Renoir
line: No. Look at me, I said no. I am not letting my daughter risk her life. Alicia.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m not Maman. I’m not going to lose myself if I stay!

speaker: Renoir
line: I know full well you will. And I am not doing this again.

speaker: Maelle
line: No! Papa, what are you—

speaker: Renoir
line: It’s time to go home.

speaker: Esquie
line: Mes amis!

speaker: Monoco
line: All aboard!

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso, come on. Come on! I can see them.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa did it so easily. What am I doing wrong?

speaker: Monoco
line: Don’t be discouraged. It’s only been a day since you remembered your Paintress side.

speaker: Esquie
line: We believe in you!

speaker: Verso
line: Remember them. Painting isn’t about verisimilitude. It’s about essence. The truth of who they are. Your father made the Axons, right?

speaker: Monoco
line: She Who Plays with Wonder. He Who Guards Truth With Lies.

speaker: Verso
line: They’re the essence of your mother. And… your brother.

speaker: Lune
line: How did we—

speaker: Sciel
line: We gommaged…

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle… Your hair?

speaker: Maelle
line: We have much to talk about.

speaker: Lune
line: So you are her daughter. And you are a Paintress too.

speaker: Esquie
line: So cool, right??

speaker: Lune
line: And you. You knew this whole time. You fucking coward. You betrayed us. We trusted you and you—

speaker: Sciel
line: You can bring them back too, yeah? Everyone we’ve lost.

speaker: Maelle
line: I— Yeah. But I need chroma. And Papa controls all the chroma in the Canvas.

speaker: Lune
line: No. Not all of it. The Expeditioners, the ones killed by Nevrons. Gustave noticed their Chroma remains in their bodies. They never dissipated, like the Gommage.

speaker: Maelle
line: Hmmm. It’s old chroma, not pure. It won’t be like bringing the two of you back, but… we could use it in other ways.

speaker: Monoco
line: Time for the greatest Expedition in history.

speaker: Esquie
line: Oooooh, everyone’s mad at you.

speaker: Verso
line: Are you?

speaker: Esquie
line: Esquie can be sad or bad or even rad! But never ever mad. Bad things happen when we get mad.

speaker: Verso
line: Oh, I know.

speaker: Esquie
line: But I can never be mad at you.

speaker: Sciel
line: Save it.

speaker: Sciel
line: I don’t need your mea culpa. You did what you felt you had to. Of course, you were wrong, but… oh, well.

speaker: Verso
line: I thought you’d be more upset.

speaker: Sciel
line: I was. I got over it.

speaker: Sciel
line: Everything I knew about our world is wrong. And you know what? I don’t care. ‘Cause death isn’t death anymore. And that means, I can see my husband again.

speaker: Verso
line: Sciel…

speaker: Sciel
line: Oh, please. I’d sacrifice you in a heartbeat to get him back, so… I understand. We’re good.

speaker: Verso
line: Thank you.

speaker: Sciel
line: As long as you help me bring Pierre back. You owe me.

speaker: Verso
line: You got it.

speaker: Verso
line: Lune…

speaker: Lune
line: I was right not to trust you.

speaker: Verso
line: And what would you have done in my position?

speaker: Lune
line: I wouldn’t have betrayed my expedition. I would have warned them that everyone they cared about was about to be erased. That THEY were about to be erased. I would have told them the truth. Because after everything we’ve been through, we deserved that.

speaker: Verso
line: So you’d choose your expedition over your mother?

speaker: Lune
line: That’s your problem, you think in false dichotomies. It wasn’t an “either/or” situation. Other solutions were possible, if you’d only trusted us enough to ask.

speaker: Verso
line: Knowing what you know now, would you have helped me force my mother out of the Canvas?

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t apologise for saving her. But I am sorry I broke your trust. And I will do everything I can to help bring everyone back.

speaker: Lune
line: I guess we’ll see…

speaker: Monoco
line: Not to say I told you so, but I do believe that I did in fact… tell you so.

speaker: Verso
line: Thanks for the support.

speaker: Monoco
line: Was it worth it?

speaker: Monoco
line: What will you do now?

speaker: Verso
line: I’ll do my best to earn their trust back.

speaker: Monoco
line: Quite a steep hill to climb.

speaker: Maelle
line: We have to push Papa out of the Canvas before he erases everything.

speaker: Verso
line: I’m surprised he hasn’t already.

speaker: Maelle
line: He’s been weakened by his battle with Maman. That’s probably why he hasn’t come after us. But it won’t stop him for long.

speaker: Verso
line: If you and your father keep fighting, you risk breaking the world again. Another Fracture, but this time, it might be you trapped inside the Monolith.

speaker: Maelle
line: What’s the alternative?

speaker: Verso
line: Maybe… Maybe you should go home.

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso…

speaker: Verso
line: You’re fighting each other, but you’re all doing the same thing.

speaker: Maelle
line: No.

speaker: Verso
line: Aline wants her son back. Renoir wants you and Aline back. You want Gustave back. The cycle we needed to break wasn’t the Gommage. It’s your family’s cycle of grief.

speaker: Verso
line: Our whole world carries the burden of your family’s grief.

speaker: Sciel
line: Nice hair.

speaker: Maelle
line: Oh, yeah, that.

speaker: Lune
line: I can’t believe there’s another world out there. A world I’ll never get to see.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m sorry. I didn’t— My memories— I would’ve told you if I’d known—

speaker: Lune
line: Don’t apologise. You were trapped too. You lived among us. You’re one of us. Even if you’re also one of them.

speaker: Maelle
line: It’s… so weird. I have memories of two childhoods. Two homes. Two Lumières.

speaker: Sciel
line: You’re not an orphan anymore. You just found your family. Don’t you want to be with them?

speaker: Maelle
line: I love my family, but… they’re all gone. In one way or another. And you’re my family too. So are Gustave and Emma. And I didn’t see it at the time, but all the families who took turn taking care of me…

speaker: Sciel
line: Maelle.

speaker: Lune
line: This is a lot to take in.

speaker: Sciel
line: Yeah. But for the first time in a long time, I have hope.

speaker: Maelle
line: Wait for us here. It’s dangerous for you near Papa. We’ll have to move fast, I can’t maintain them for very long. Tomorrow comes.

speaker: Verso
line: Your father. He’s at the tower.

speaker: Maelle
line: Yes.

speaker: Lune
line: Maelle…

speaker: Sciel
line: Your father’s been extra inspired.

speaker: Monoco
line: A most enticing challenge.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa’s over there. And the chroma we need to bring back Lumière.

speaker: Sciel
line: Even I can sense him…

speaker: Lune
line: We’d better make sure we’re ready.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa.

speaker: Renoir
line: Alicia.

speaker: Maelle
line: Please. I just want you to understand what this Canvas means to me-

speaker: Renoir
line: I do understand. I know how powerful and intoxicating it is, how deeply attached we can become to the worlds we pour our hearts and souls into. I was enthralled and it nearly killed me.

speaker: Maelle
line: That doesn’t mean you have to erase Verso’s Canvas!

speaker: Renoir
line: Child, do you think I want to? After all the sorrows we’ve endured, do you really think that I want to destroy that last piece of his soul?

speaker: Maelle
line: Then don’t. Don’t.

speaker: Renoir
line: Life keeps forcing cruel choices. We do what we must.

speaker: Sciel
line: Grief often blinds us. And we make choices we can never take back.

speaker: Renoir
line: You grieve for two.

speaker: Sciel
line: I grieve for many.

speaker: Lune
line: The choices of parents leave indelible marks upon their children. But ultimately, the voices in their head have to be their own. You cannot set the boundaries of their life for them.

speaker: Maelle
line: After the fire—You wanted me to find—new joy in life. And I tried. But I couldn’t. I couldn’t. Verso died because of ME. How do I get from that to joy?

speaker: Renoir
line: Child, it will get better. I promise you. But this is not the way. Your friends speak truth, and it changes nothing. You can hate me, but that’s a choice I must make. As your father, I must look out for you. Especially when you can’t look out for yourself.

speaker: Maelle
line: You treat me as if I’m still five…

speaker: Renoir
line: I treat you as if the shadow from the worst day of our lives is going to suffocate you and take you from us too. Enough. I said enough.

speaker: Monoco
line: I do love a challenge, but this is beginning to irk me.

speaker: Lune
line: Fuck. He keeps regenerating.

speaker: Sciel
line: Maybe we focus on the Axons first?

speaker: Maelle
line: (gasp)

speaker: Verso
line: No! She can’t-

speaker: Maelle
line: Maman??

speaker: Renoir
line: Aline, you’re going to kill yourself? It’s too soon for you to return to any Canvas! Aline! Look at Alicia. She can’t be here! Aline, it’s supposed to be you and me, not you AGAINST me.

speaker: Renoir
line: Ironic. Your mother was the one who saved me, when I lost myself in a Canvas. She—She taught me how to safely use our gift, how to soar without flying too close to the sun. We—We Painted hundreds of Canvas worlds, pushing the very boundaries of creation. And she never let me forget that every day we spend here has a price. Yet—(cough) Yet here we are now.

speaker: Maelle
line: So trust her. If she’s doing this, then—

speaker: Renoir
line: I trust what she taught me. This is not a game! You think you know what’s at stake, but you don’t!

speaker: Maelle
line: I know precisely what’s at stake! You want control, you want to feel like you’re doing something. You couldn’t save Verso, so you want to save us. Except you’re not. Destroying the Canvas won’t help us move on, it’ll just deny us the one place that helped us feel again.

speaker: Renoir
line: 67 years. 67 years, I spent trapped within the Monolith. But I persisted. I persisted. Do you know why? Do you know why I CANNOT leave her or you behind? This is what I see every day. I cannot spend another day with living corpses. Since the fire, our family has crumbled. Aline in the Canvas. Clea fighting her solitary war. You, a living ghost. Verso’s death broke us. I want it to be fixed. I need it to be fixed—I—(cough). I cannot lose you too.

speaker: Maelle
line: Don’t you see?? That’s how I feel about them! I can’t lose them either. I’ve lost too much. Papa, see. I’ve lost so much.

speaker: Renoir
line: We’ve both lost so much.

speaker: Maelle
line: Papa. I don’t want to lose you either. I’m not leaving you forever. Just a little longer.

speaker: Renoir
line: I want to trust you, but…

speaker: Maelle
line: You can.

speaker: Renoir
line: I’ll keep the light on for you. I hope you find peace. Hold onto each other.

speaker: Lune
line: Verso…

speaker: Verso
line: I’m sorry.

speaker: Verso
line: Hi. You’re tired of painting, aren’t you? I’m tired too…

speaker: Maelle
line: That’s—Oh. You shouldn’t be able to be here.

speaker: Verso
line: Maman’s gift.

speaker: Maelle
line: Why did you run in? It’s dangerous for you here.

speaker: Verso
line: “See things as they are, not how you want them to be.”

speaker: Maelle
line: What?

speaker: Verso
line: You lied. To your father.

speaker: Maelle
line: No, I—

speaker: Verso
line: He saw it too. But he wanted to believe. You’re going to die here. Why don’t you just leave? You can always come back.

speaker: Maelle
line: The moment I leave, Papa will erase this canvas.

speaker: Verso
line: This is not worth your life.

speaker: Maelle
line: What life? My life of loneliness in a shell of a body? With no voice and no future?

speaker: Verso
line: You’re Maelle, no matter where you are. You don’t need this canvas.

speaker: Maelle
line: But everything I want is here. Here I have a chance to live, Verso. To live. Out there, I merely exist.

speaker: Verso
line: “Life keeps forcing cruel choices.”

speaker: Maelle
line: Stop quoting Papa!

speaker: Verso
line: It’s time to stop Painting.

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso… Papa also said, “Hold onto each other.”

speaker: Verso
line: I’m sorry.

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso, stop! You can’t just decide this for everyone!

speaker: Verso
line: We’re all hypocrites, doing the same thing to each other.

speaker: Maelle
line: What about Lune and Sciel and Monoco? What about Esquie?

speaker: Verso
line: Sciel was right. Grief blinds us. All you see are walls.

speaker: Verso
line: Alicia, I beg you, stop him from painting.

speaker: Maelle
line: Don’t say that, please, don’t say that.

speaker: Verso
line: Hey, please, listen to me. Only you can do this. You can do this, please. Unpaint me. Unpaint me!

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso…

speaker: Verso
line: Please. I don’t want this life.

speaker: Maelle
line: Stop saying that.

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t want this life… I don’t want this life…

speaker: Maelle
line: I just– I just wanted to live this lifetime together. This lifetime that was stolen from us. Please, brother… Please.

speaker: Verso
line: I don’t want this life… Help me… help me…

speaker: Maelle
line: If you could grow old… would you… find a reason to smile?

speaker: Maelle
line: Verso, stop! You can’t just decide this for everyone!

speaker: Verso
line: We’re all hypocrites, doing the same thing to each other.

speaker: Maelle
line: What about Lune and Sciel and Monoco? What about Esquie?

speaker: Verso
line: Sciel was right. Grief blinds us. All you see are walls.

speaker: Verso
line: I’ve lived a long time, Maelle. There are things we can never outrun.

speaker: Maelle
line: I’m so tired, Verso. Please, can we just go home and talk about this?

speaker: Maelle
line: Don’t do this. Don’t leave me again.

speaker: Verso
line: It’s gonna be ok… It’s gonna be ok, huh? You’ve got this incredible power to paint. You’ll never have to suffer a life you don’t want. You’re ok. You’re ok. You’re ok.

speaker: Verso
line: I will miss you guys.

speaker: Verso
line: It’s ok. It’s over. Verso.
